Reviews.Title: “I recommend this hotel to everyone!”
Reviews.Author: fmmc
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the location - close to the airport and the beach area. We stayed after our cruise and really lucked out with this place. It was very clean, had friendly and helpful staff, and a great hot breakfast! The pool patio was very clean and inviting, with a hot tub and bar in the same area. Our room was large with two comfortable queen size beds, and the bathroom was also very large and clean. They also provide free internet from either your room or the computer room off the foyer. They are close to a number of restaurants and bars for either local cuisine or your standard North American chains. We two women felt quite safe walking around outside (however, I wouldn't venture down to the beach at night), with many police patrols visible. It's only a $20 taxi ride to downtown Old San Juan. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed; hotel unable to remedy situations; switched hotels mid-trip”
Reviews.Author: Suiteflute
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are taking our honeymoon in PR. We decided we'd stay in a nice resort for the first few nights, and downsize for the last 3. Based on mostly good reviews, we chose Hampton Inn & Suites. It wasn't ALL bad, but bad enough for us to check out early, ask for a refund, and go elsewhere When we arrived, we thought it looked quite nice. The lobby is well done. Staff is friendly. We were given a "non-smoking" room that reaked of smoke. It was also damp, smelled moldy, had a very strong "covering-up-bad-smell-with-low cost air-freshened" smell. It was quite gross. The carpet is a dingy brown, and the rooms are dark. Not much light from the window. We checked diligently for bed bugs and found none (phew!). Bathroom had a bad smell, and tub was DIRTY. We opened the window, but mosquitoes swarmed in . We asked for a screen for the window to air out the room. They do not have screens. We asked to switch rooms. We were told that no other rooms were available. So we stayed the night. They told us that the next day they'd do an air purification treatment in the room. When we came back after being out for 4 hours, there was a small machine in the room , barely making noise, and seemingly not doing much. The smell was overwhelming. They said they couldn't switch our room until the next day. That night, we found an online deal to spend our last night in a luxury resort up the street. That day, a staff member had told us that people before us had complained about that room. The occupants the previous week were smoking. So, the hotel KNEW that the room had a foul odor, yet they did not remedy the issue before putting guests in the room. We checked out early, and at the desk there is a plaque that states that if the customer isnt satisfied they don't have to pay. We were comped one of the nights. I didn't push for both. Staff are friendly, and seemed to understand Side note: LOTS of families with kids. We knew that going in, but just reinforcing that it's a family hotel. I'm not one to complain, and this place wasn't a complete flop.

Reviews.Title: “3 star hotel in a 1 star neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: Floridasailor_11
Reviews.Content: Room is good. (King suite facing pool). Average condition, few amenities (no bar, restaurant, etc...except pool bar w/food outside). Quiet...except for some airport noise and loud voices from adjoining room through closed doors. Typical free Hampton breakfast buffet. However, lousy neighborhood. Run down, dirty streets and buildings. Nearby beach is dirty with piles of sea weed. Next time I would pay the extra for Condado area resort hotel or stay in Old San Juan. It's $50 round trip cab, incl tip to Old San Juan, where all the city's character is. Spend a day touring Old San Juan, impressive castles/forts, neat streets and shops. $19 plus tip to Pan American cruise ship dock from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Tanabata
Reviews.Content: Before we were ready to take off on first cruise, we stayed at the Hampton Inn & Suites in Isla Verde. It is well located, being about 15 minutes from the airport and in walking distance to key places in Isla Verde. The front desk staff was very friendly from the first point we arrived. I liked how they had free drinks all day. The interior of the property was nice, but the room was worn around the edges. It was obvious that the lobby and other areas of the hotel were refurbished while the rooms were a bit neglected. However, the room was spacious, and the beds were comfortable. We had a nice view of pool. The free breakfast was a plus and helped to save time since we had a tour of El Yunque rainforest the next morning. On our first day, I really wanted to try the infamous El Churry sandwich, which has three types of meats served from a food truck on Isla Verde street where we where staying. It was a long walk from the hotel through rain and way at the other end. Sadly, when we got there around 4 p.m., the truck was closed. However, that night we walked across the street to another Hilton property, El San Juan Resort & Casino, and caught a free concert featuring the Gypsy Kings. Overall, it was a nice stay at the Hampton Inn and in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hampton Inns”
Reviews.Author: Golfer88
Reviews.Content: I'm a fan of Hampton Inns, as they consistently seem to offer the best value for the money compared to any other chain. The San Juan Hampton Inn is just terrific. The front desk staff is charming, friendly, efficient and helpful. The food at the grill by the pool is great, especially the burgers. The view to the parking lot isn't the best, but a couple of drinks cures that. Our king suite was spacious, clean, quiet and comfortable, also with a lousy view, but that wasn't why we were here: just an overnight before a cruise. The gym and pool are both kinda small but perfectly decent. Excellent breakfast in a comfortable setting. The location is great, right by the airport, with plenty of restaurants nearby and the beach across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay when in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: kikig1064
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom suit with our 4 year old daughter in December. The hotel was very clean and staff friendly. THe breakfasts were enormous and they had coffee out all day as well as water. Once a week there is a Happy hour at N/C - it was not advertised so we stumbled upon it - nice! It is located right across from the beach - however, the beaches were very windy. also, the pool is nice but it is not heated SO it was very cold. The price was spectacular. It is not as POSH as the resorts across the street, but it is affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Comfortable Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Huaschalocro
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel costs more than I usually pay for Hampton, it is worth it. It is modern and clean as a pin. The location is excellent. It is a few steps from the beach and near many restaurants. The rooms have large flat screen tvs with adequate cable. There is free wifi and wired internet. They have a good breakfast with some hot items changing daily. What really makes this place special is the people running it. Although there is no conscierge, the front desk fills in admirably. They are anxious to make your stay pleasant and productive.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HattieMags
Reviews.Content: We flew from Vieques to San Juan the day before our flight home to the US and stayed in the Hampton Inn while in San Juan. The hotel was great!! The room was clean and comfy, the breakfast and dining area was lovely and the pool was fantastic! Also having the pool bar and grill was a nice relaxing end to our vacation before an early flight home the next day. It is close to SJU airport so you do hear the planes when outside but not from the rooms. I slept great! Also is very close to everything so we walked to dinner and around downtown. Will absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Very Clean but............”
Reviews.Author: mrgeemoney
Reviews.Content: Went to the Heineken Jazz Fest and choose to stay here for the good price. Hotel is in a excellent location with Denny's and a CVS across the street. The food from the pool bar was grilled and great. The only complaint I have was that the maid came early in the morning twice and opened the door with a fast knock while we were sleeping. The 2nd time she came back I told her to come back in a half hour. When I left the room all of the clean ladies where in the hallway still working and said hi to us. When we came back to the room 4 hours later the room wasn't cleaned. We had to call the front desk for soap and clean towels. The next day was our check out day and the maid still came knocking on the door early in the morning. Other than that the staff was very friendly! The room we had (453) had water stains on the wall by the door from an apparent leak from the ceiling, but it didn't effect our stay at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SailingTime
Reviews.Content: Would definitely stay here again. Great linens and bed! You can eat your complimentary (nice, large selection of items) breakfast outside by the pool if you like. Fairly expensive, but all the hotels are. A selection of restaurants within a few blocks that you can walk to. Good beach also within walking distance. You can walk to a bustop that will take you to Old San Juan (about 45 minutes) for $.75 exact change. Taxi to airport was about $16.00+ - seem to have a standard rate, same each way.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel for work or vacation”
Reviews.Author: rrmambo
Reviews.Content: I got to Puerto Rico for work, usually a couple times per year. I stayed here in March of 2012. The lobby has been renovated and the staff at check in was super friendly. This Hampton has a pool and a pool bar/restaurant. The rooms are clean and quiet, free breakfast, gym, business room. The usual amenities for Hampton. The location is great. It is a 10 minute drive from the airport ($13.00 fixed rate cab) and there are a lot of restaurants, shops and hotels within walking distance. Isla Verde beach is also a short walk. It is close access to the highways also. There is a good mix of guests, business people, tourists and airline industry. I have stayed here before and I will again. They give a discount with AAA also.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was worth the stay!”
Reviews.Author: PKB82200
Reviews.Content: My family stayed overnight before our cruise the next day. This hotel is bigger than the usual Hampton Inns we have here in mainland. The lobby is spacious. And the staff were smiling and willing to help. The room I chose was the suite since there were 3 of us. I was suprised when we entered as the room looked like that of the Embassy Suites. It was just refreshing. The casinos, Walgreens, and restaurants are just across the street. The neighborhood was safe to walk around 9 pm. It is very close to the airport. But there is no shuttle service. I like this hotel and I don't mind coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Really convenient”
Reviews.Author: GVAtraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night while connecting flights. Friendly, nice pool where we hung out with the kids, breakfast was good, good pool food at the grill, took the family suite which was perfect for us (we're four). Convenient to get to the airport. Supermarket nearby (walking distance). Old San Juan is lovely to visit. Recommend

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joe_Mc_Hon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is easy to find and very clean and nice like most Hamptons. The pool and Jacuzzi were good. They have a good free hot breakfast. The parking at the hotel is extra $10 per day. You can come and go as many times as you like, but you have to stop by the front desk to get it parking ticket validated. The parking in San Juan in the tourist sections hard to fine. The Hampton is walking distance to the beach if you are in average shape and to several good restaurants. I stayed at several Hotels in San Juan and this one of the best values. It is also very quick and easy to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hampton Inn, Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: Michael_K_SNJ
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at dozens of properties throughout the Hilton family, ranging from high-end Waldorf Astoria properties in New York or the Conrad in the Maldives, to not-so-stellar places such as airport Hampton Inns. Because this property was so close to San Juan airport, I was assuming it'd be like your typical airport budget hotel...but was surprised and delighted to see it was not. This property is great --good location, great staff, and nice interiors/rooms --definitely the best Hampton Inn I've stayed at.... and generally nicer than more than 70% of Hilton Hotels I've stayed at. The lobby featured new/modern decor...as did the room. The bed/furnishings were high quality....and the materials in the bathroom (granites and beautiful tile) were too. The room was quiet and very clean --I remarked at how "fresh" the room smelled when I first walked in. They provided the typical Hampton Inn breakfast, which included fruits, cereals, carbs, and some hot options which included cheese omelets, bacon, and make-your-own waffles. There was plenty of self-dispensed juice to drink too in addition to coffee. You can eat at table seating, bartop seating, or outdoors by the pool. The pool was nice --large and clean, and featured a swim-up bar to a bar/grill in the rear of the property. The food at the pool bar/grill was top-notch; I was shocked I was eating in a Hampton Inn and shocked I was eating at a pool bar/grill with the type of quality I was enjoying. Bar/grill staff were very friendly. Front desk staff was cheery and helpful. There was an error on my folio at check-out that they promptly fixed. The location is good; a short 2-3 minute walk across the street brings you to the Ritz Carlton, other nearby casinos, or the beach. I felt safe in and around the hotel. Overall, a great stay in a great property with great service. So much so the hotel should bear a more upscale brand than "Hampton Inn."

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Pre-Cruise Stop”
Reviews.Author: NHPhotoMom
Reviews.Content: We arrived VERY early for our check in (after an early morning flight) and the front desk staff, Eric, was more than happy to accommodate us. We were able to check in super early and he gave great recommendations for how to spend our day. They rest of the staff was courteous and helpful as well. Hotel was clean and quiet. The pool area was very nice, though the whirlpool could have been a few degrees warmer for my liking. :)

Reviews.Title: “Hampton is GREAT”
Reviews.Author: empac99
Reviews.Content: Hampton beds are the most comfortable. I never have had an issue with a room, staff, service...anything. The Carolina, PR Hampton is no exception. Nice lobby. Nice pool and swim-up bar. Good atmosphere; comfortable, even luxurious, but not too uppity. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “More than a hotel near the airport”
Reviews.Author: 124C41NewEngland
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for the last night of a Puerto Rocan vacation because it was reasonable and near the airport (literally 5 minutes). I wasn't expecting much, just a standard Hampton Inn. What a pleasant surprise. It was excellent. Nice big room, fee WiFi and HBO, and a great pool with a pool-side bar. The complementary breakfast even included omlets! While there is no on-site restaurant he hotel is just a block from El San Juan Resort and Casino and two blocks from more beach front resorts. You didn't even need a taxi to get to a dozen restaurants. Parking at the Hamption was free and the staff were all extremely helpful. I had a flickering light in the bathroom and mentioned it to the front desk, in 15 minutes it was fixed and the front desk called to make sure it was working correctly. Wow! If you can give up actually being on a beach (and with many of the Carolina resorts not all the rooms can actually see the water) this this is an excellent option.

Reviews.Title: “More than an ordinary Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: travels46
Reviews.Content: I was really surprised. This is not your ordinary Hampton Inn. For instance, there's a big pool, with a pool side bar and grill (open to at least 21:00). They serve real drinks, and grill big burgers, skirt steaks, and prepare other full meals. The place seemed more like a small resort than a "room only" hotel. This Hampton is located on a good street, with lots of outside restaurants and bars, all within walking distance. It's close to the airport as well. I would be happy using this hotel for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: pearson30
Reviews.Content: We had never been to the Isla Verde area but decided to stay there overnight so we would be close to the airport for an early morning flight. We were pleasantly surprised by the hotel's location which was within walking distance to upscale restaurants and casinos. The area felt very safe also. The hotel was very clean, staff very helpful and we chose a King suite overlooking the pool which was fantastic. We did not get a chance to use the pool but it looked very nice. They had a manager's reception in the early evening with drinks and opportunities to talk to the other guests and staff - very nice touch. The breakfast was good and as an added bonus we were at the airport within 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: jfar88
Reviews.Content: I spent one night here for a pre-cruise stay. It was the best idea ever! In all honestly, it was the perfect choice. It is only a few minutes from the airport. The cruise ports are about 10 or 15 minutes away. Walgreens and the bus stop is located across the street. A few streets down, you'll come upon a nice beach. The rooms were clean and modern. Nice lobby and area for a good complimentary breakfast. The pool area is a miniature oasis in itself. You can't complain about the rates with everything that is offered. However, one of the cons is the noise from airplanes, since the airport is so close, but it didn't really bother me for my one night stay. Also, Carlos was helpful with checking us in and giving us some pointers but, the rest of the staff have their heads up their you-know-whats. All in all, a nice stay and I was happy with my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel..Number 1 for a reason”
Reviews.Author: Bogey5380
Reviews.Content: I stayed here several times. It is far the best hotel in the Isla Verde area. The airport is right behind the hotel. The only blemish. The rooms are clean and the breakfast is really good. I will absouletly recommend this hotel for anyone staying in the San Juan

Reviews.Title: “Great for location and price!”
Reviews.Author: Bael
Reviews.Content: I came back to Puerto Rico on a business trip for a week. Since I was limited to a small selection of hotels via my company's travel website, I found and settled on this one. Located in the town of Carolina on Isla Verde Ave where all the choice hotels are and just minutes away from the airport, this hotel serves as a good access point to San Juan, access to major highways, and in my case for this trip, the location where I had to work. The major factors I chose this place: Free breakfast. And they have a good selection of waffles, donuts, cereals, eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, the works. When getting up in the morning, I didn't want to have to leave the hotel to find a place to eat and then get to work. It was just way more convenient this way. And it didn't suck. Safe gated location Self serve parking(I can't be waiting on valets when I need to get somewhere on time) Walking distance to the beach and restaurants. Nice big swimming pool for when I wanted to stay near home after a long day at work. My stay: Customer service is very good. They are friendly, chatty, attentive to your needs and best interests. They really seem to go out of their way to make sure you are enjoying your stay and want to come back. I'm not even joking when I tell you they go out of their way to assist with with anything you need. My room was spacious. The bathroom was fully loaded with complimentary toiletries for me to load my bag with everyday and store at home for future personal use. The bed was big and comfy. There was a small living room area with TV, couch, chair, coffee table. I had a desk where I could put my laptop and handle business. Everything was clean and tidy. I left a good tip for the chamber maid when I departed. Note: There is a cock-fighting stadium right behind this place. Too bad I didn't get to see a match. There's also a really nice local style food restaurant right next to the stadium. They've got mofongo and a big selection of Puerto Rican food that you might not find anywhere else. Funny thing, it's next to a cock-fighting stadium and they just happen to serve a lot of "Chicken specials of the day". How's that for exotic? Just kidding. So if you're going to Puerto Rico and want to stay near San Juan, this place is a really great deal for the budget conscious person. The free breakfast really makes a difference too!

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vazquetelles
Reviews.Content: Great service, great breakfast, super clean rooms. It's small but has all you need from a hotel, GYM, pool, continental breakfast, great outdoor Bar & Grill with awsome food there ribs are GREAT! Really recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Magnolia48
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel a few years back and having a positive experience, we booked a pre-cruise overnight for this trip. Again, we were not disappointed. The hotel is clean, has a nice pool with a swim-up bar, free wi-fi, and a great complimentary breakfast. It is within walking distance of the beach, casinos, restaraunts, and various stores. It is about 5 minutes from the airport and 15 minutes from the cruise port.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lighthouse21
Reviews.Content: Stayed here mid Nov and loved it. The outside pool bar has great. The food is outstanding and the drinks were reasonably priced. Room was clean and quiet. Great location walk to beach, walgreens, restaurants. Safe neighborhood. Hotel parking $10 a night

Reviews.Title: “2nd Review of this hotel....had to take a star off”
Reviews.Author: Jolene1975
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Hampton Inn this year and my second review. I had to take one star off of the previous review due to a backslide in the housekeeping department. Upon first checking in for this stay we were assigned a room upstairs. The room looked like it had been cleaned and made up properly but upon inspection, I noticed that one of the beds had small black hairs all over it. I went downstairs and they immediately assigned me another room, this one being on the first floor. All was well the first night but again the housekeeping showed signs of weakness. Two of the four nights we were there we did not receive any washcloths. One of the nights our clean bath towels were draped over the toilet tank instead of on the rack...disgusting. It was also obvious that our sheets were never changed for our four night stay. I find that unacceptable as well. We leave tips every day and are very tidy in our room because we do not like to be a burden on the staff but this was obviously not appreciated. Other than those issues, the hotel is still a good bet. They are under renovation right now but travelers are not inconvenienced by it at all. I believe the renovation is supposed to be completed by the end of November. The free breakfast has been moved from the lobby to a conference room down the hall. Parking is still a bargain at $5 a day. (Other hotels charge between $15 - $20.) The Wifi signal also seemed stronger than on my previous visit in June. I did not have any trouble connecting with my mobile device. This hotel is frequented by many business travelers and airline staff as well. It is not a resort but a solid hotel in the Isla Verde area. I hope they address the housekeeping issues.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly what it looks like on the website”
Reviews.Author: aproudlocal
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel and is currently undergoing some renovation/improvements (as of 10/2011) so it should be even nicer, BUT that won't change the fact that this hotel is in a strange, cramped, and less than "resort like" neighborhood. Right next to a cock fighting arena, it is difficult to see unless you know exactly what you are looking for. I had gone to the Hampton website numerous times before our trip, but when driving in the neighborhood of the hotel I missed it twice while driving right past it. The hotel does not offer a shuttle so you will pay $10 for a taxi from the airport. The breakfast was great. The pool is nice but VERY busy.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Great Location”
Reviews.Author: wnliz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn in early September, The hotel was clean, cozy, and the location was great since we had many restaurants and shops close by. The free breakfast was a plus! The pool was nice and relaxing it had a swim up bar, which was great when you wanted to get a nice ice cold Pina Colada on those hot days. The staff was friendly, the only problem I had with the staff was the fact that they didn't know much about the area? I found it strange that they work there but didn't really know a lot of places I mentioned, and recommended places only close by. I had a car and wanted to drive around & try different restaurants and places to see. The only other problem I would say I had with this Hotel was one morning, I put my suitcase on the bed to look for something and when I noticed on the bed there was a bunch of little ants crawling around, then I looked on my suitcase and they were everywhere! When I went to look at where I had my suitcase on the floor, I found a nest of ants on the corner of the wall. We were all itchy and it was disgusting, we called front desk and right away they sent someone upstairs and they said they would spray something in the room and when we get back it will be fine, I then requested a new room because we all felt uncomfortable. We left and a little while later they called and gave us our new room number. When we got back we had to make sure we cleaned off our suitcases and belongings and went to our new room. (Much Better!) This was the only problem we had here, and the fact that they took care of it right away made our stay much more enjoyable. Overall, this is a nice hotel if youâ€™re looking to save some money. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, definitely would go again.”
Reviews.Author: ISmilitarytraveler
Reviews.Content: The staff are very friendly and accommodating. The whole hotel is clean and pleasant to be in. Parking is an extra $5 a day but that us fair compared to other locations in the area. Breakfast is included but if your kids like cereal ask for it. For those who keep kosher, Chabad is a five minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top Value”
Reviews.Author: Saints2
Reviews.Content: Close to the port and airport, very clean, friendly staff, nice informal poolside eatery. Excellent value!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: #1Barb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn 2 days prior to leaving on a cruise. The people are wonderful, the room is very nice. They have a nice pool. They serve food by the pool which was also very good. Their breakfast was good (and free). You are close to the beach, all the casino hotels and a quick taxi ride to Old San Juan. We enjoyed our stay so much that when we go on a cruise next year we will be staying at the Hampton Inn :-)

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: redwee
Reviews.Content: I generally stay at the Marriott, but found the rooms at the Hampton Inn to be nicer and much cheaper. The breakfast, also free, was quite impressive. The staff are friendly and helpful. My son had a painful toothache the last night we were in San Juan, and though the hotel did not have any children's Tylenol, they offered to drive me to the nearest Walgreen's at 2:00 in the morning since I had no rental car. The printers worked in the business area so I could easily print my boarding passes. The rooms are new and clean. The pool area is nice. There is no restaurant except the cafe in the pool area but the burgers were passable. No beach access, but the Carolina Public beach is a short walk away. I would stay again for the service and the price.

Reviews.Title: “Hampton Inn, San Juan Airport”
Reviews.Author: smitty747
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hampton Inn for one night pre-cruise. After arriving on a "red eye" from the west coast, we were fairly tired and ready to relax a bit. Even though it was only 11AM, the hotel staff was kind enough to allow us to check in early and gave us our keys right away. The hotel was clean and while this is no "resort", it has everything you could need for a short stay of 1 or 2 nights. The pool is small but nice and even has a swim up bar at one end. The bar cooks burgers, hot dogs and few other local items. It's a great little area just just relax and enjoy the tropics after a long flight. The rooms are fairly well kept and the bedding was clean. Even though it's located pretty close to the airport, noise was not a factor while inside. While at the pool, the planes could still be heard, but it's a momentary distraction at best. The hotel has a couple of other nice features like a business center that had 5 computers (great for emailing friends/family and gloating that you have arrived in the Caribbean) and also a self-serve breakfast in the morning. Breakfast alone probably saved the three of us $40. While the hotel is not located very close to Old San Juan (about 15 minutes away), taxi service was easily available. Also, since Hampton is close to the airport, the taxi from the airport was not overly expensive. There are plenty of restaurants and casinos nearby. Our only wish would be that the hotel had an airport shuttle. Overall, we enjoyed our stay here and it's perfect for pre or post cruise nights. Hampton Inn is a good choice for keeping your budget in check, but still getting a few perks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: CruisingBajan
Reviews.Content: On arrival, we were warmly welcomed by Naomi at the Front Desk, who was very attentive and helpful. She quickly browsed the system and offered us two options for accommodation and gave a summary of an excellent special that was currently on for the King room which had a sitting area as well. Excellent upsell because the room was very spacious and clean for just an additional US$10. Naomi knew her stuff - in both English and Spanish! The facilities were very well kept and the Housekeeping was outstanding. The room was ready right away, which is always a plus. The complimentary breakfast was good and other bonuses like newspapers were readily available. It would be an excellent choice for business travellers, but is equally suitable for couples and families. Excellent surroundings, helpful and well-informed team members and good location make this hotel an excellent choice in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: 01dFo1ks
Reviews.Content: Great breakfasts, responsive and helpful staff and comfortable rooms. Not a beach front hotel, but the beach is a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: jmsx1964
Reviews.Content: I took my two college age kids for a Chrismtas vacation and this hotel was very adequate and priced great. The beach is a few blocks away and there area ton of shops and restaurants close as well as a supermarket a few blocks away. It was a very safe area and i would recommend if you have a tight budget to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SuzieQ-B
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days prior to going on cruise and found this hotel to be very clean and enjoyable. The rooms were nice and staff even nicer...excellent swim up bar at the pool with great food, cold drinks and even better prices. Tuesday evenings they have a nice little welcoming event which included free bar drinks and lots of nice little snacking choices all for free. The breakfast buffet has large variety both hot & cold items with lots of coffee and beverages again for free. There was a nice beach not even a 5 minute walk from the hotel which chairs were plentiful and water was nice. Theres a Wallgreen across the street and Starbucks nearby with little shops along the way for those odds & ends. Would definitely stay there again, should we return to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Rose up to Irene”
Reviews.Author: fitgator
Reviews.Content: Before I even begin to review this hotel, I have to commend the staff at this hotel. Let's be honest, we all well know that Hampton Inns are in the lower spectrum of the Hilton chain. That is no secret, and this hotel does not deviate from the obvious. So, what separates one chain from another is its staff and the little things that people do to make your stay memorable, comfortable and in this case (with hurricane Irene in tow) bearable. With more than a million people in Puerto Rico without electricity and some even without water, the Hampton Inn in San Juan, kept its composure and more importantly, electricity, water, food, entertainment and surprisingly enough, internet service as well. People were fed, attended to and serviced with a smile. Rooms were clean and everything in my room was in perfect order. Remember that the people who work at the hotel are residents of the island and them too, had no power or water. They showed up and displayed their best. The hotel offered a very nice breakfast, had DVD movies showing at the lobby and kept the small but adequate fitness room operating so that people would have a choice and avoid "cabin fever". The hotel is relatively a short walk to the beach which normally I would had checked out. I hope this comment gets to everyone at the hotel and most importantly, to the powers to be and recognize these wonderful people that pulled it together in the face of adversity.

Reviews.Title: “NO Compensation!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kenneth D
Reviews.Content: Hotel stay was good till a storm came which knocked out the cable and forced me, my wife and 7 month old son to stay in the room and do nothing, not even internet, they say high speed online but your better off not even using it. Was forced to go to the hotel up the street were family was staying (by the way they had no problems during the 3 day storm, cough cough Embassy Suits), so we could actually keep track of the wether (found out a tornado had passed threw). On the 3rd day (today) with no cable or "internet" I asked if we could be compensated at all, their answer was they have dvd's. I know no one wants a storm to pass through and mess things up, but come on are you really not going to compensate me paying $130 a night for half a room, take some money off at lease. But thats ok I'll be calling the higher ups in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: couplehappy
Reviews.Content: Checked in 4 hours early and the room was ready. Very clean, safe and centrally located, walk to the beach, nice pool and free breakfast! Room was very clean, spacious and comfortable. Would definitely return to this hotel if we go back to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: terrimg
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Hampton Inn one night before cruising out of San Juan. They could not have been more accomodating. Arrived quite earlier than check in time and they locked up our bags and sent us out to enjoy the pool until our rooms were ready .Nice clean room with two big beds and a sleep sofa. After a great cruise we returned to the Hampton to spend the day as we had a late flight home. Nice pool/hot tup with outside grill and bar. Burgers and a cold beverage by the pool...what more could you ask for!

Reviews.Title: “Want fast internet for business needs? Don't go here.”
Reviews.Author: noxe666
Reviews.Content: Hotel stay is great, staff rules, location is outstanding unless you're outside hoping not to listen to jumbo jets accelerating on the runway on the other side of the treeline, where you have to pause your conversations until the jet clears the runway, and then you can continue talking while breathing the jet fuel fumes. WIFI internet? Yes, you can get connected. Then, expect the speed of a 2400 baud dial-up modem circa 1996. Daily, it's useless for any kind of business correspondence over the net. My iPhone was able to watch Netflix movies every night without issues of the CELLULAR network, but this hotel can't get their internet to breach speeds higher than a snail on a turtle's back? Come on, Hampton!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luckyluke25
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel twice pre cruise and loved it. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. Rooms a clean and comfortable. Location is very good 5 minutes from airport and a short walk to the beach. We find this hotel to be the best value for your dollar and have it booked again this year pre and post cruise, which we are very much looking forward to.

Reviews.Title: “A site for sore eyes”
Reviews.Author: rwilliam
Reviews.Content: My family and I only had the opportunity to stay at this property for one day. We loved its amenities, its location, and the continental breakfast. We especially loved that it was walking distance to the beach. Their staff was helpful too. Upon our departure from the hotel and arrival to the airport my 12 year-old son realized that he left his brand new baseball glove in the room. We immediately contacted the hotel and their staff went back to check the room. My husband & son went back to the hotel to retrieve right before we had to board. for home. Had a great time in that area and look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever & Will Stay Again Next Time In Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Jaynie W
Reviews.Content: Stay at the Hampton Inn for 4 days and 3 nights. My husband and I went to PR for his 30th birthday. Arrived at the airport 1 hour before the Hotel staff kindly allowed us to check-in early. The Hotel is modern and I think the the atomosphere is very relaxing. The hallway on the floor that we stayed on was never loud it was quiet. Breakfast was excellent and the staff their made sure your needs were met at breakfast time. The pool and hot tub are clean and fun. Towel were provided in the pool area. The beach is a short walk away. DO NOT get a rental car because everything is nearby. The bus is safe and it cost $0.75 to get to Old San Juan and $0.75 back. Very cheap compared to $20 the taxi cost one way. The Casino was modest size and I got luck while there. The night club with the EL San Juan Hotel and Casino is upscale and very nice $20 to get in. Prefect location everything is withing walking distance. Will only stay at this Hampton Inn Next time I travel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Jan46671
Reviews.Content: Prior to going to this hotel I did read a negative review about bedbugs; and the first thing I did when I got into the room was check for them--nothing! But what I will say is this, the hotel was very clean, the staff was very friendly and helpful; and the breakfast was excellent. Each morning we were up at 6 am, and at breakfast by 7:30 am.; it was empty, quiet, and a pleasure. I grew up with parents who always left the hotel maid a tip, and I am no different, but I was really surprised that my maid, (her name is Blanca) did not take my tip; and I was curious why? Unfortunately, she didn't work on the weekends! Walgreens is right across the street, and also on that side of the street you can keep straight, veer off to your left, and you are on the beach. Its a beautiful beach, and is great for early morning risers and rising sun seekers. Loved it, and its really less than a 5 minute walk, at best. We also rented a car with Alamo, and the hotel charged only $5 a day for parking. Overall, it was a good hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: IndianaLuvs2cruise
Reviews.Content: This hotel suited us just fine, it was clean, the people were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was ok but could have more hot items. We will be using this hotel again in January .

Reviews.Title: “Okay for a short trip”
Reviews.Author: caazgurl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night. We booked through travelocity. We were delayed one night and travelocity said the hotel would not refund us our money for the night, so oh well, live and learn. The front desk staff were helpful and friendly. The room itself was pretty clean except for some black marks on the walls. I didn't complain because I was so exhausted from sleeping at the (ATL)airport the night before. I would stay here again for one night but if I was planning a longer stay in San Juan, I would pay the extra money for a four or five star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: vacati0ning101
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. We stayed for a week and could not be more pleased. The room was ready when we arrived....no musty smell, bathroom was spotless! It was a comfortable suite.Breakfast every morning was fantastic...many choices. Pool and hot tub clean and well kept. Front desk helped us with everything we needed...very professional. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but certainly not up to standards”
Reviews.Author: topfan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed one night on the way to St. Croix. The person at the desk who checked us in was rather cold and unfriendly, not something we're accustomed to at this level of hotel. Fortunately we didn't spend much time at the hotel because we wanted to explore OSJ. The condition of this hotel was decent, but our room and hallway were a bit tired looking. The air conditioning was mediocre, cooling the room marginally. The view from our room was quite unpleasant, unless one likes looking at a cockfight building and it's parking lot (see photo). The location is close to the airport and taxis are readily available and convenient. If we're in SJU again I'll likely look somewhere else for a nicer facility.

Reviews.Title: “warning!”
Reviews.Author: tashapej
Reviews.Content: We just came back from beautiful San Juan and I have to tell you guys the hotel was almost perfect...buffet breakfast,reasonable price,kind and charming staff,pleasant pull (little bit dirty though ) good location...but....bed bugs!!!! I can't stop scratching my self!! So now you know, and I believe not every bed is infected ,but mine was...:( and yes internet was impossible to use cause it was too slow.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: JenniferThomas
Reviews.Content: The staff is great. The rooms are clean and well kept. The breakfast is excellent. The swim up bar and grill is pretty awesome too! If you don't want to pay Old San Juan prices, but want to be close to all the activities this is a great option. The Isla Verde area is great! You are only a 5 minute walk to the beach, a 10 minute drive to the airport, and a 15 minute drive to Old San Juan, plus there are tons or shops and restaurants just a few steps from the hotel. We will certainly be back!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: cjb38
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quiet and very clean. The rooms were very nice with wonderfully comfortable beds. Although close to the airport we had no trouble getting a fabulous nights sleep. The breakfast offering is very good, with a large variety of options. Great coffee too! Staff was friendly and helpful. This hotel is only a short walk from a great beach.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: Jolene1975
Reviews.Content: This was not a vacation per se but we had to travel to Puerto Rico to attend to family matters and took in some sites as well. The Hampton Inn is not on the beach. The beach is a short walk across the street and down the road a bit. If you are looking for a hotel on the beach, this is not the right place for you but it suited our needs just fine. Pros: - Clean - Comfortable beds - Free expanded continental breakfast including waffles, muffins, bagels, juice, fruit, cereal, sausage, yogurt, etc. All of which was delicious. - Helpful staff - Nice pool with swim up bar - Parking is only $5 per day - much cheaper than other hotels in the Isla Verde/San Juan area - Minutes from the airport (SJU) Cons: - The free wifi is sporatic at best. I had a lot of trouble maintaining a connection with my mobile device in our room and could not access it at all by the pool. - Proximity to the airport does make for jet noise. This may be objectionable to some but it wasn't to me. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel good service”
Reviews.Author: Shawn02
Reviews.Content: The best feature of this hotel is the pool and the breakfast. The pool has a swim up bar but was rarely seen being used during our 10 day stay. The pool area is clean but the lounge chair cushons could be taken better care. The hot breakfast was nice but could offer a few options. The fresh waffles that were offered daily were a nice addition. The fruit was quite sour and the eggs were a bit dry but can't complain too much as there is a larger variety than what Ive had at other hotels. The rooms were clean and housekeeping was there first thing in the morning. The staff was very courteous and professional. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at Hamtpon Inn!”
Reviews.Author: TennTraveler54
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hampton Inn for one night pre-cruise. It was a quick 10 minute ride from the airport and about 20 minute drive to the Pan Am cruise pier. The morning of checkout we found an employee outside who was helping guests get cabs and we had no trouble finding one immediately. The rooms were quiet, in spite of the proximity to the airport. There are many restaurants within walking distance. We walked across the street and were on a beautiful beach within just a few minutes, where we enjoyed pleasant walk, then into the casino of the El San Juan Hotel for a little gambling in their casino. Then into the pool and hot tub for more evening relaxation. The Hampton staff could not have been more friendly and helpful! When we asked a question, they would respond and always add "...is there anything else I can do for you?" The breakfast buffet was excellent and plentiful, with lots of seating area and tables for everyone. Hampton exceeded my expectations and I would definitely stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “It was AWESOME! Can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: Liz-Rosse
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my bf. The bedroom is big & clean, the bed is super comfortable & king size, have a very good size TV, the bathroom was ok, but the bathtub was a bit small. The beach is 5 minute walk & you can find various fast foods near the place so you dont have to waste money. Overall, I had a lovely, fun & romantic experience. Can't wait to go back. HIGHLY RECOMENDED!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel good for overnight stay after long flight”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night after a long journey from the UK. We find Hampton Inns a good value, comfortable stay for a short trip. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is included and is basic but good. Bed was just so comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean hotel 5 min walk from beach”
Reviews.Author: kawai_nikon
Reviews.Content: We had decided that we wanted to stay an extra night in Puerto Rico to visit more of the island after we completed our Carribean cruise. We found this hotel through hotels.com and carefully read the reviews before we left. Since the overall rating was good, we decided to book. And we were happy to see that we had made the right pick. Check in was fairly quick even though there was a long line-up upon arrival. Parking cost less than $6 tax in for guests.The room was beautifully furnished with top notch furniture and comfortable bedding. The business center had three computers with complimentary internet access (very slow though at times). Complimentary breakfast offered waffles, eggs, sausage, all types of breads, coffee cakes, cereals, fresh fruit, orange juice, and good coffee. Everything was delicious except for the sausage which looked really dry and not too apetizing. Great location, 5 minutes walk from beach and about 15 minutes from airport. Hotel has a beautiful jacuzzi and outdoor pool with pool bar. Pool towels are provided even when we went to the beach. The pool bar also prepared barbecued food and we absolutely LOVED their baby-back ribs made by Jay. Remember that name, cause he is the guy you want behind the grill and who will make the difference in your appreciation of this meal. He is such a pro at this and trust me you won't eat any other ones like these! Chicken burger was also very tasty and juicy as well as their hamburgers. Salad side dish was not very generous, so we ommitted the chips and asked for more greens, which they happily did. Drinks are very cheap. We stayed at a different hotel when we arrived in Puerto Rico the day before our cruise and we were very disappointed, even though the cost was very comparable. So this one is definitely a keeper!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Help Ease Our Grief...In Fact, It Added More!”
Reviews.Author: HectorsTita
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at the Hampton Inn and Suites San Juan (HISSJ). Both times I've had to complain to management about the lack of cleaniness. After this visit, I'm done giving them chances to redeem themselves. We're an Army family with 5 year old twins and a disable mother (wheelchair bound). We received the news that my father-in-law passed away and we had to make last minute arrangements to travel home to PR for the funeral. I relied on a hotel that we knew would be close to the house, close to the beach for our children and big enough for our entire family. I decided to return to HISSJ. Our first visit back in August of 2010 left us with an uneasy feeling as we had to report blood spatters in the bathroom of our suite. Management took care of it immediately, comped one night and gave us a gift basket with gift cards for the Chili's down the street. Looking back I can only imagine what happened in that bathroom to make them go out of their way to rectify the situation like they did. This visit I called and pleaded with the reservation line and the front desk to provide us with a wheelchair accessible room. "There's absolutely none available" was the response I received. I asked for them to let me know if one became available during our stay and even made a note on the online reservation form. The second day of our stay I noticed a swarm of ants in our bathroom. I found that they'd gotten into my daughter's hairbrush and immediately went to the front desk to report it. They offered me the room next door and gave me a key to check it before we moved. Lo and behold, it was a room that had a wheelchair accessible bathroom. I voiced my disgust with the manager and the Hilton customer service line that I was told there would be no availability for my entire stay only to be given a room even though the staff had no idea if I even needed a handicapped room (I now see why people who really need one have such a hard time getting them). We moved and they comped our first night. The next morning I wake up and as I'm going to put my mother into her wheelchair, I discovered an army of ants crawling all over her chair. She had to sit on the toilet for 20 minutes while they sprayed down her chair and we waited for the fumes to subside. We checked out immediately after getting dressed and packed (3 days early). This hotel is not cleaned with any sort of effort. I have stayed in 3 different rooms and all three left a lot to be desired in the area of cleanliness. There are holes where the plumbing is exposed, fingerprints on doors and walls, dust, and pests. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone, even if the stay is short. Hilton has lost major points in my book because of this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value/Conveinent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DanaF88
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week with a large group of friends from Boston. Our flight arrived late at night and left late on our check out date. The staff was extremely accomodating with holding our bags and checked us in as early as possible. The pool area and rooms were much nicer than I expected and very clean. We made friends with the waiters at the pool bar, and the prices were reasonable. The hotel is 3 blocks from the beach and close to Walgreens/Pueblo market for anything you might need. We did a lot of exploring around Puerto Rico and found it very easy to get cabs/book trips from the hotel. For what you pay this was a great hotel. The breakfast wasn't phemonmenal which is my only complaint, but you get what you pay for. On the whole the staff was very friendly/accomodating to us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a pre or post cruise day.”
Reviews.Author: Edmondo25
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last Sunday for one overnight after disembarking from a 7 day cruise. This was our second stay here and it met our needs perfectly. We arrived at the hotel at about 8:30am and no surprise, there was no room ready for us. That was okay because we then took a ride (we rented a car from Avis after getting off the ship) to El Yunque rain forest and explored for a couple of hours. When we returned, the room was ready and we hung out at the pool for a while. We did plan to take advantage of the poolside grill for dinner, but when I walked up and ordered two burgers I was told that it would be at least an hour wait. Hmmm...we went to plan "B" and walked down to the beach/pier and went to a nice little restaurant instead - "La Playita." Our flight home was at 10:30am Monday so we had a leisurely morning to finish packing and have breakfast before the 5 minute ride to the airport. We had none of the problems listed in some of the prior reviews. I did not give it 5 stars because it is not a 5 star hotel. It's clean with a friendly staff and typical Hampton Inn amenities. We paid $190 US for this night. Staying that one extra night saved us about $400 on airfare, and twist my arm, I had to stay in Puerto Rico for one more night. It was a great addition to a wonderful vacation week.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: wayneled
Reviews.Content: Large double queen room with 2 flat screens. AC works great. Dehumidifies too. Restroom large and clean with plenty of counter top. Beds very comfortable. Super convenient to food, liquor, farmicia (walgreen's), and aeroporto. The staff were professional and friendly. i reccomend this hotel vs Embassy Suites for business.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jeff013
Reviews.Content: Stayed two night pre cruise. A nice clean hotel with decent rooms plus a free continental breakfast. There is some aircraft noise since the hotel is close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingQueeen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hampton inn for 7 nights & I loved it! It was nice, quite, & relaxing. The hotel was VERY clean & the rooms were huge. The hotel is positioned in a good spot on the strip so you can walk to different local places. As for the airport noise, you only hear it by the pool & not in your room..BUT you will hear that same noise at any other hotel on that same strip! Trust me, I went visited other hotels. Bottom line, stay here! The food is good, the staff are nice & accomadating, & it's a lovely place. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great spot”
Reviews.Author: offdutyOshawa
Reviews.Content: We're here right now, pre-cruise, and the atmosphere, service and rooms are all very well done. Comfortable, convenienent and with a wonderful pool and spa area just off the lobby, makes for a wonderful way to relax in the warm San Juan evening after a long day of travel from sub-zero Toronto. As Arnold would say, 'We'll be back".

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: mom2two2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for what we needed for a pre-cruise stay of one night. After a very long day including 2 flights and lost luggage we were beat. The hotel is close to the airport, there is a pharmacy across the street and a great pool area. It was clean and safe and staff was friendly. The little grill by the pool was awesome and the burgers were delicious. We expected very limited choices but their menu was a lot broader than we expected, including chicken and even, I think, steak. Breakfast was larger than your usual continental type and more than what we needed. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Near to airport”
Reviews.Author: diegocarmont
Reviews.Content: we stayed on a suite, was great just as emabssy suites, it is located on a good neighborhood all right to go for a walk, and many restaurants to choose for. The price is not so good, cause embassy charged me the same and its far to be equal. A supermarket is close by also.

Reviews.Title: “Insects, Mold & More”
Reviews.Author: Peter061
Reviews.Content: Based on positive reviews, we decided to stay at the San Juan Hampton Inn & Suites during a stopover prior to a Saturday cruise departure. The hotel is simply not worthy of any association with the Hilton name. Carpets were worn and stained, the bath tub was ringed with mold and the walls were marked and dingy. When we encountered several species of insects including one crawling across the bed, we asked for a change of room which was quickly accommodated. The new room showed the same tired and dirty look. The staff was very accommodating and polite during our stay, but good humor and pleasant attitudes do not make up for a tired worn property. There has to be a better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - close to beach, services, lots of amenities”
Reviews.Author: scotiajim
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night prior to boarding a cruise. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the rooms spacious and well appointed, and there was plenty to keep us busy on site/nearby (pool, fitness center, beach nearby, plenty of restaurants within walking distance, casinos, shopping, etc). Pool and hot tub were both well maintained and there was a swim-up bar that served drinks and food. The free hot breakfast in the morning was stocked with everything you could imagine for breakfast. Free WiFi too. Only two negatives and both were minor. First, it was right next to the airport and so the noise of planes taking off during the day was a bit distracting. Also, we had no HOT water (lukewarm only) in the morning for showers.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and affordable”
Reviews.Author: MCinAustin
Reviews.Content: Convenient location to the airport, beach and great starting point for vacation in Puerto Rico. Nice pool area. Breakfast and on site parking add to value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service, great breakfast, clean throughout”
Reviews.Author: OnBudgetTraveler
Reviews.Content: Hampton Inn San Juan is a pretty standard business-oriented place. Perfect service, great breakfast, clean throughout. However, I stayed there not for business but for pleasure over Thanksgiving holidays. The objective was to drive around so I did not really care that hotel is not on the beach. I spent a day in El Yunque park, another day in San Juan downtown, and two days visiting remote beaches such as Seven Sea, Luquillo, Loiza, and Piones. On the last day, I found that Balneario beach, which is in 5 minutes drive from the hotel, is one of the best in the area. In the evenings, there were plenty of restaurants around, Walgreen and Pueblo supermarket. I did not have any problem to walk to the beach at night. The room was very good (see photos). Airport was not a trouble. My room was facing airport but it did not bother me at all. Parking was $5 a day. Driving was relatively easy, probably because I expected the worst but actually it was not that bad. Overall, I am very satisfied with the hotel and the service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Nice Location, Wonderful Grill by the Pool”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelers2012
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location and easily accessible. The room was clean and the front desk staff were friendly. I would recommend an ATM in the lobby and more proactive tour information from the staff (we didn't know there was a free trolley in Old San Juan until our third day there). The grill by the pool was awesome!! Jay cooks wonderful food - the best in San Juan!! Would definitely recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “About the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: crow66
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before picking this hotel. We spent 8 nights there in a King Bed Suite on the 3rd floor overlooking the pool. I have no complaints about the room. Some of the features I really enjoyed was the extra TV in the other half of the room-separated by a door. Laundry facility on the 2nd floor of the bldg. we stayed in--the hotel is two bldg's connected in the lobby. And surprisingly the bed was comfortable for that many nights with a temperamental lower back. My husband did not feel the same--but it was more a pillow size issue. Lots and lots of towels so we were able to take to the beaches with us--but they also have them by the pool area. You have to walk to get to the beach--but I don't hang out in crowded beaches so this isn't an issue for us. We'll go for long rides for a quiet beach, make sure we can get some food, bring our beverages, find a palm tree and set up camp. We had a safe, microwave, fridge under a separate sink area right outside the bathroom. The week we were there--day after Thanksgiving--was a quiet week at the hotel so the pool was never too crowded. It seemed to be like that all around San Juan though. Jacuzzi was great. The bar/food area by the pool was nice--we ate there once and loved the skirt steak. Right by the hotel are two very good restaurants: Platos and Metropol-both make great Mojitos. About the full American breakfast--that so many reviewers said was great or amazing or whatever--I pictured someone is actually standing behind a counter and preparing eggs--NOT--these are processed eggs (think McDonald's/Burger King). Amazing is how many ways they can dress them up and serve them in a week's time-that they come prepackaged like that!! And the next worse thing about the breakfast--the tea and coffee without half and half or whole milk. My first morning they had the half and half but my tea tasted so weird--maybe the water? So that and the huge TV with the news on was annoying--but there are good things about the breakfast: they have a belgium waffle machine so you can make your own, they have cereals and fruit and cold muffins and bread, toasters and such. The coffee is good. After our second morning disappointment we just went for a walk and ate at Mi Casita for breakfast everyday. The weather was just perfect for walks in the morning. About the airplanes and the airport--yes you will hear them clearly by the pool area. And I always heard them from inside the room--it's just muffled. Similar to living by some railroad--but blocks away where you hear it but it won't wake you up at night. About safety: there are plenty of police and military personnel around. Everywhere. A bit overkill--it makes tourists feel safe and it's good for the tourism business of the island. Overall-I would definitely recommend this hotel for the price, the quality of the room and the location for casinos and night life. One doesn't even have to rent a car because excursion companies pick you up and bring you back. You can take a bus to Old San Juan and return by cab if it's late. The taxi service has a set price for the popular locations.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly like to pictures”
Reviews.Author: travelingcanadian_10
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for a week, and had a very good time. We arrived early in the morning, and they were very accommodating, letting us check in early. We had a suite with a king bed, and it was very comfortable, had very good sleeps. Every time we went down to the front desk to ask about a restaurant or something, they were very helpful and sure to make sure we had everything we needed.The continental breakfast was good too. Overall we had an excellent stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Please anywhere but here, the locks in the whole hotel were not working”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoFlandBeyond
Reviews.Content: The key card locks in the whole hotel were not working. The desk staff knew this and still they checked us in and gave us bogus cards. The staff opened to our room after 15 to 25 swipes. Cigarette smell in the room, we did this twice with the same result, finally they made Master keys for everyone, and passed them out. Better, but someone needed to be in the room the whole time with the dead bolt latched. Our third room was nice, but by then it was too late to leave the hotel, a day wasted at the Hampton Inn San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay for convience and the price”
Reviews.Author: Jacque72
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at this Hotel for the past 4 years and it has always been a great place to stay. This year there had been an unfortunate event that had happened and the hotel General Manager Myrya ( Spelled wrong) went above and beyond in correcting the problem. She was absolutly wonderful!!! Everytime we have stayed there it has always been clean, staff is very friendly and accomadating, and the breakfast is always great. I go to Puerto Rico every year and ever since I stayed here for the first time, I have always gone back. And I will still continue to return there every year with no question. Excellent place to stay for the money, convience, and cleanliness.. Thanks again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for a night in San Juan!!!”
Reviews.Author: Seka'sGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after our cruise and it's a perfect place to spend a night. The rooms are fantastic, beds are fabulous, pool was refreshing. We had our dinner at the grill, yummy homemade hamburgers. The front desk staff were all pleasant and helpful, they stored our luggage when we arrived saturday morning as the rooms were not ready yet. The bus stop to Old San Juan is just across the street, very convient. You can hear the planes taking off as the runway is close to the hotel but its no big deal. The only close shopping is a Walgreen's across the street, with a few other stores in a small mall. I would definately recommend this hotel !!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and great location”
Reviews.Author: gcmartinez
Reviews.Content: One of our better choices without breaking our budget . Clean and modern facility which even included breakfasts. We would have a quick breakfast and be gone all day seeing the island. Often didn't return to our room till late at night and were never disapponted with the hotel. Great facilty for familes - kids always were in the pool having fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay near the airport”
Reviews.Author: Willister
Reviews.Content: Would highly recommend this hotel. We stayed the last night our vacation to be near the airport. The rooms are wonderful, beds are very comfortable, pool area is great. The price was reasonable and the complimentary breakfast is very good. There are restaurants across the street. We only heard the airplanes when we were outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: muffyf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn on Isla Verde for 7 nights. The suite was a little smaller than Hampton Inns we've stayed at in the states, but they provided us with two cribs for our baby and toddler and everyone fit fine. The pool was great, we couldve spent our whole vacation there, and only crossed the street to go to the beach once. There is a lot of shopping in walking distance for the needs of a family- Walgreens, grocery stores. The free breakfast at the hotel was wonderful, the staff was friendly and helpful, the rooms clean. The nearby airport was very loud though, and the hotel is located on a very busy street.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY, LOCATION, AND PRICE”
Reviews.Author: torri_97
Reviews.Content: Visited San Juan this past weekend and I must say that this hotel is awesome. It was very clean, affordable, attractive and the staff was professional. Room was nicely decorated, always filled with fresh towels and linen. The bed was sooooo comfy!!! The pool bar is the best. The price of food and drinks at the poolside bar is definetely affordable and great. (Try the grilled chicken breast and the prime ribs). The computer lab is clean, nice and free with internet. The staff was always attentive to every need, friendly and professional. It is centrally convienient to restarants, walgreens, a supermarket, casino's and most all 2 blocks away from the beach!!!! The breakfast was not the greatest, but was ok. Consider Dennys for breakfast which is located across the street on the second day of your stay or wait until lunch time and get food at the pool bar... The only thing i would recommend is The walls in the bedrooms just need a lil touch up with painting. Improve the breakfast choices.

Reviews.Title: “SPent one night before going on cruise”
Reviews.Author: romebound
Reviews.Content: Our room had a water leak and they moved us down the hall.The breakfast was OK but on the way back to room, a large roach crossed in front of me.The location was good but it rained and the water flooded the exit of parking lot.Pool was very small,no hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable digs”
Reviews.Author: HockeyPhool
Reviews.Content: Very enjoyable stay at the Hampton Inn & Suites in San Juan. The pool is nice and has a bar & grill poolside. Complimentary breakfast was typical for the Hampton brand but offered a decent variety of foods. Rooms were clean, comfortable and nicely decorated. Free WiFi worked well, even on the top floor farthest from the core.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: OhioLadyDee
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel and an incredible value. Traveling with hungry teens, the breakfast bar was great for stretching our meal budget. We stayed in a two room suite which was great for a week long stay, so we would not tripping over one another. The beds were incredible... crisp and clean with two choices of pillows (soft & firm). The overall hotel (both interior and exterior)was nicely decorated and the pool area was lovely (especially at night). The hamburgers at the poolside grill were delicious ( a big hit with my teens) and convenient. The hotel is within walking distance of the beach, a Walgreens, a city bus stop, and literally dozens of resturants. We ate at several of the local ones, and never had a bad meal. Only a few details kept this hotel from getting a perfect mark...First, we had water leak from the room above us (in the shower) but someone came up right away to address it and clean up, but it was still a small annoyance and the plumbing needs to be addressed before it becomes a regular occurance....they could stand to vaccum the hallways/rooms and pool a little more often, and they should paint the interior room doors (they were off-white) and refinish the bathtubs. As these areas need some attention, overall though this is a solid establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Essellanden
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, breakfast buffet included and only $5/day parking. Close to Pueblo supermarket, airport and various restaurants. Good service by the front desk: when I had a problem with the wifi internet, they brought me a regular wired modem. Can be busy at weekends: there was a very long queue at the front desk to check out when we were checking in early.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Enviorment”
Reviews.Author: NLucas0718
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel was great! Anytime we needed directions or suggestions they were happy to help. The room was clean and updated, more then we expected. The breakfast every morning was definitly a plus. Safe and fun. Will definitly stay agian.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Adnile
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed at The Hampton Inn during our August summer vacation in Puerto Rico. The hotel staff was great! The hotel is near the airport and outside you can hear planes but we didnâ€™t have a noise problem inside. Route 37 Isla Verde Avenue has lots of restaurants. There is a casino and a great beach across the street. Our room was clean and we had a microwave and refrigerator. There is a Pueblo Supermarket near Embassy Suites in walking distance and a Walgreen pharmacy across the street. The complimentary breakfast buffet was fine and the server Adriana was great. If you like hamburgers, I recommend trying them at the grill in the pool area. Very large burgers cooked to order. The business center is nice if you donâ€™t have a computer to use the free Wi-Fi plus the business center provides free printing. The staff (especially Omar at the desk) was wonderful; they were very helpful in recommending restaurants, tours and routes to drive. The IL Nonno restaurant located at 41 Isla Verde Avenue had great Italian food. Driving was an adventure because the roads are not clearly marked in some areas but the hotel staff provided printed directions to most places. This is an excellent hotel for the price, in a good location with a great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Clientele is A Strange Mix”
Reviews.Author: TMSHawaii
Reviews.Content: This hotel - I think - is supposed to be a business hotel. As a business hotel, it's got some very nice features: 2 minutes from the airport, decent internet bandwidth, a nice business center with 4 HP towers and a laser printer, quick dry-cleaning, in-house coin laundry, quick in-and-out parking, and very close to restaurants. However, the hotel is 2 blocks from the beach. As a result, the clientele is a bit skeevy. Small children in wet bathing suits running wild in the hallways, screaming to all hours. Teen baseball teams creating long lines, noise, and chaos at breakfast. To me, businessmen and vacationers do not make a good mix. But the hotel staff were perfectly bi-lingual (surprisingly rare in Puerto Rico), very cordial and helpful, and I would have to say overall my experience at this hotel was a good one. I think next time I will stay at the Doubletree, which is not near the beach and seems a bit more business-oriented.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DeJu
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. The property is very clean, beautiful, and spacious. The front desk staff were all bilingual and very helpful. They gave me local maps and great information. The breakfast was awesome. Every day it was a little different...but always had a egg product (scrambled, premade omelets), biscuits and gravy, sausage, ham, two waffle machines, yogurts, fruits, cereals, bagels. Lots of options, and they never ran out. They even brought out extra tables and chairs when it got crowded. Lots of the flight crews stay here! Super friendly staff! I was a little hesitant about the motel...but it was awesome! Nice area that you can walk to lots of restraunts and feel safe. Everything was better than I could have imagined! Stay here and you won't be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Wonderfully Managed!!!”
Reviews.Author: RedCarnationReady
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Hilton-owned San Juan Hotels and I was so pleased to find that this Hilton run Hampton Inn has the same high Hilton standards. Wonderful staff, clean rooms, plentiful breakfast and most of all, a really nice crowd of people! I love that this is a non-Casino hotel, but there are many casino's nearby if that's your thing. I found it easy to take the bus to/from Old San Juan from here and it's literally across the street from the beach but their pool was a quiet beautiful spot. I will definitely return!!! Book a room here without hesitation, you'll be pleased! Thank you Front Desk, Bell staff, Housekeeping and Breakfast staff --you are really doing a great job!!!

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Mini~Hilton Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gone~Walkabout~Man
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights, April 20th to 23rd, 2010. I stayed in room # 333. I paid $ 135 USD per night. This hotel belongs to the Hilton family of hotels. I really enjoyed my stay. My room was a one King bed room. Great bed, clean linen. The room was very clean. I had free WiFi internet in the room. Free breakfast was included in the price. I have read that other guest's paid $ 5 USD for parking. I had a rental car, and, the front desk always validated my parking ticket, everytime I wanted to depart the hotel. I don't think the front desk makes this function known, and, those other guest's probably never asked. The palapa bar out by the swimming pool, is a great place to un-wind every night. They do grill up some nice meals there for you, along with refreshing drinks. The only planes I ever heard taking off or landing, was when I was out at the palapa bar. When in my room, I never heard any jet noises at all. I definately recommend this hotel to everybody. On my future visits to Puerto Rico, I will be booking this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: Well_Traveled_53
Reviews.Content: Nice clean room, nice breakfast, free wireless internet, walking distance to beach, across the street from casino, close to the airport, nice pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: PattiDallas_Tx
Reviews.Content: We had a great 7 day stay at this hotel. Our family of 5, 2 adults and 3 teenagers, stayed in a suite, 2 dbl & sofa sleeper, with frig, safe, microwave, bar area. The free breakfast was really good and the staff was very helpful. Parking is only $5.00 a day and we felt safe at our htoel. Great burgers, grilled chiken at the pool grill. We ate at DonJosa and Piu Bella and the food was good! Also there are many fast food places just down the road, Wendy's, Pizza Hut, KFC, Taco Bell, Subway, Chili's. Walgreen's across the street and a larger grocery storeabout 5 blocks away. Guest laundry on the 2nd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: ricco_chico
Reviews.Content: I would like to inform you of our recent stay at the Hampton Inn Suites Hotel in San Juan, Puerto Rico. I reserved 3 suites. We had one suite reserved for 5-28-10 the suite was ready and my sister could immediately check in. We had a connecting suite for 5-29-10. When my wife and I arrived we learned that one of our suites were accidentally booked the prior day. We spoke with the Manager, who apologized for the mishap and advised that she would do her best to accommodate us. Not only did she do her best she went above and beyond and we just wanted to let everyone know that we had a wonderful time at the hotel, we were very satisfied with the rooms, the staff was great, the free breakfast was an added treat, the food at pool side was fantastic. We look forward to our vacation there next year. I am so glad my wife booked reservations at this hotel.
