A few of our family and friends stayed at some of the pricier hotels and they informed us that the service was not that great. Again, I would like to thank the staff at the Hampton Inn & Suites for their exceptional hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, quiet, and a great location.”
Reviews.Author: jerseyguy405
Reviews.Content: I was in San Juan for a week for business so I wasn't going to be spending a lot of time at the hotel. I just wanted a clean, comfortable room in a convenient location. The Hampton Inn was perfect. There's plenty of parking which was a big plus and for only $5 a day. The room has a nice big flat screen tv and a refrigerator which is nice as I like to keep cold water and some beer in the room. The desk staff was very helpful in recommending places to eat. The pool area is very nice and very clean. There is a swim-up bar and grill which has very good food. If I go back to Puerto Rico for busniness I'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: carterc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn one night after a cruise. We were traveling with 11 people in their late 20's and had booked 3 rooms on travelocity. The nice thing about this hotel compared to other hotels in San Juan is you don't have to pay extra for the 3rd or 4th person in a room and you don't have to pay the resort tax that many other hotels require. We got off the ship and to the hotel around 11:00 and 1 of the 3 rooms was ready so we could check in early. The front desk was very helpful in setting up some tours for our group. The beach is very close but the pool was great for us. We spent a lot of time relaxing on their lounge chairs and enjoying the hot tub in the evening. The swim-up bar has good food, but it takes quite a while to cook your burgers. The rooms were nice with free wi-fi, a flat screen tv, and comfortable beds. Thebathroom was large with lots of counterspace. The complimentary breakfast is very good with the usual cereal, bagels, pasteries, but also some hot food (eggs). Overall we were very impressed with our stay here and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, friendly staff, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: NSGRAMMIE
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel after we came back from our cruise and this place was very nice. When we got there the rooms were not ready (2 rooms) but it wasn't a very long wait for our rooms. While we waited they stored our luggage for us and told us we could use all the facilities, pool etc. It has a beautiful pool area with a swim up pool bar & grill you can eat at. The prices were a bit high but the food was good. The rooms were nice, clean and fresh. The staff was very friendly and helpful. This Hotel is across the street from the beach but you just have to walk across the street to the beach and it is handy to the airport, just a few minutes away. There is a Walgreens across the street and just up the street of course is Chili's. Very good place to eat. The Hampton has a continental breakfast but we didn't get a chance to try it because our flight left early in the morning. All in all this was a nice place and I would definitly stay there again. Wish we had booked here before the cruise instead of the ESJ.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but overpriced and not willing to go the extra mile...”
Reviews.Author: hockeyfamily20
Reviews.Content: We got stuck in San Juan after being bumped off our flights all day long. We fly stand by, so we're not eligible to have our hotel paid for by the airline. We had just spent 4 days at the Embassy Suites Dorado del Mar, and had been at the airport since 5 AM. The last flight left at 7:45 PM without us on it and so we called around to find a hotel. We got to the Hampton Inn & Suites around 9 PM. We were exhausted. Since we are a family of 5, a room with 2 beds doesn't accomodate us. After explaning our situation with being stranded and having sat with 3 kids at the airport all day, I asked for a roll away and was told it was going to be another $20 or we could switch the room type and have a pull out couch for an additonal $40. The room rate was already pretty steep. Our rate for a suite at the Embassy Suites in Dorado which included 2 beds and a pull out couch on a beautiful resort property was less before these additonal charges even! We declined both and took the standard (overpriced) room. Our teenager slept on the floor. The room was nice, but a little worn. The walls had scuff marks on them everywhere and the furniture is pretty banged up. Also, the room is pretty cramped. The pool and the pool bar were right out side of our window, so it was a little noisy. We went back downstairs and asked if there was anywhere to eat. The front desk employees were friendly and helpful and gave us a lot of options of places we could walk to for dinner. We returned and went to sleep and checked out the next morning at 5 AM. This hotel is nice, but definitely overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay before a cruise.”
Reviews.Author: luv2cruz77
Reviews.Content: We came in a couple days before a cruise and stayed here. Someone in our group had been there before and recommended it. The rooms were nice and our stay there was pleasant. There was free breakfast in the morning that was very sufficient. One night a neighboring room was having a fight in the middle of the night. We called security and it was taken care of very quickly. There is a Walgreen's within walking distance if you need to buy a few last minute items before cruising.

Reviews.Title: “Great value. Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Edmondo25
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a long weekend in Puerto Rico to visit with our son who had been working here for the last several months and to get a break from the cold. We chose the Hampton Inn after reading the reviews here. I have to say that this hotel exceeded my expectations. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The breakfast in the lobby each morning was just right, it saved time and money. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. I don't know if I would recommend this someone who was looking for more of a resort stay. I think if you came to Puerto Rico and only stayed in the vicinity of the hotel, you would miss a lot of the charm and beauty of the island. We used this as a base to operate from and traveled all over the island. There is a lot at the hotel though; Walgreen's across the street and several restaurants in walking distance. A two block walk to the beach was not a problem. When we went to that beach I noticed a resort with umbrellas and lounge chairs approximately 100 yards from where we set up our towels. I walked over to get a better look and discovered that it was the Ritz-Carlton. I'm certain that none of the people there paid $179 a night to get to that beach. The pool, hot tub and swim up bar at the hotel were great. You could spend your vacation there and have a great time. On Monday we took the 75 cent bus trip to Old San Juan and explored. The desk clerk gave us excellent advise on which bus to take and also told us to take the free trolley to the farthest point out once we arrived at the bus station. That way we could work our way back through the city going downhill. That worked out great. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic customer service and bed!”
Reviews.Author: UniqueMichelle1980
Reviews.Content: The hotel wasn't located in the best of areas, but I don't think there are lot of great areas in San Juan. The hotel felt VERY safe, clean, and friendly, with fantastic amenities. They had the best hotel mattress I have ever slept on! Their free internet, breakfast, luggage storage were all so useful! Their front desk staff were knowledgeable and friendly. The hotel was beautifully decorated and the air-conditioning was nice and cool in comparison to the humidity outside. It was a very short walk to the beach and there are plenty of places to eat around, even though they have their own pool side grill. They found out it was my auntâ€™s birthday and somehow helped our travel agent to put balloons and cake in our room. They also make sure to tell her Happy Birthday when they saw her in the lobby. We stayed their b/c we were leaving on a cruise the next day and it started out the trip on such a great note! I HIGHLY recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: markh111
Reviews.Content: Though not luxurious, the Hampton Inn in the Isla Verde section provides excellent value. Some people may not like the location, which is away from the "main" part of San Juan, but I liked it: the hotel is a short drive from the airport (a ten dollar taxi ride), is located on a touristy street with many restaurants (check out Platos, across the street from the hotel, for excellent Puerto Rican cuisine), is near a supermarket and Walgreen's, is a short walk from a reasonable beach, and is only 30-40 minutes by convenient bus from old San Juan. The rooms are clean, and the service at the front desk is friendly and helpful. There is a nice pool and Jacuzzi, there is complimentary internet (and a business center with four complimentary internet-accessible computers; great for printing out boarding passes), and there is an above-average complimentary breakfast every day: all the usual Continental breakfast fare, as well as hot dishes that rotate from day to day. There are fancier hotels down the street that probably cost fifty to a hundred dollars per night more than this hotel, and offer less amenities. All told, I would certainly stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with all the right attributes for an enjoyable, convenient stay”
Reviews.Author: secondchancer
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - Not new, but is very clean and has everything you would want from a hotel. Pool area is very inviting and has a grilling station where you can have drinks and get grilled burgers, steaks,chicken, etc. Great location - near so many excellent restaurants and in a nice, safe, upscale area. Parking for your rental is only $5 per nite. (Car rental station is right across the street - convenient). Friendly, helpful staff, free WiFi and wired Internet access. Five minutes from SJU Airport. Many airline crews stath here. I spoke to one captain who has stayed there twice a week for ten years. And.... Free breakfast every morning! Not just a "contintental breakfast," it is a full breakfast - eggs, bacon/ham, juice, coffee, desserts, fruit, etc. Don't hesitate to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Met basic needs”
Reviews.Author: OregonRichard
Reviews.Content: The hotel was kept clean and in good repair, staff was friendy and quiet. For a business trip this hotel was just fine and had enough parking for guests and had easy access to the freeway.

Reviews.Title: “always safe bet with Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: JeMar06
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just one night after a late arrival into San Juan. The cab ride from the airport to the hotel was $12-$15. The room was a little small for a Hampton Inn, but still very comfy. We had enough room with our baby's travel crib to use the desk and lounge chair all at the same time. Very comfy bed, great water pressure, & nice continental breakfast. The pool area with bar looked really nice, but we didn't stay long enough to try it. The price was reasonable compared to the other options in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: bebops87018
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after our first hotel overbooked and sent us to a dump we refused to stay in- I called this hotel and asked if they had any availability. They had one room to offer and we snatched it up to get out of where we were. We only stayed one night but would stay again. Nice area, comfortable to walk around in at night- rooms were nice, breakfast was good. We didn't spend a lot of time here (late arrival and left San Juan the next morning for Luquillo) but it was a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: SwapnaMurari
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this place for 2 days...really a nice place to stay and is very near to airport aswell Old san Juan...checked in real quick..and the receptionist was very helpful in giving the maps and directions to Old San Juan...there was WIFI in the room...room service was good ..the only issue was the noise from the AC was not sure was this the problem with all the rooms or only with that of ours..:( and served the continental breakfast.The area nearby was gud for wandering..all together a nice place to stay...

Reviews.Title: “Average and expensive”
Reviews.Author: DELTRAV
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very good (assuming you have a car) and parking is $5.00/night which is very good. However, the rooms are worn down and not very clean. The sheets look old and with stains. It has a free breakfast, but it is clearly food that is tailored to the American tourist (e.g. Bagel with cheese/bacon/pizza souce on top, Muffins, etc... (thought it had fruits, which was good). In general, this hotel it's simply too expensive for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Shockingly better than most”
Reviews.Author: Lex59
Reviews.Content: I lived in PR and went back to visit as I may be moving back to start a business. I went on my own but did know people so it was a bit better but I did not want to stay outside of Isla Verde. Firstly, the people are VERY friendly as always. Secondly I worked in tourism there so I have seen the inside of every hotel and never saw the inside of a room at Hampton Inn but based on reviews decided to give it a go. Believe it or not barring the resort feel, which is no issue as you can walk to any of the resorts, it blows the rooms in other hotels, even The Ritz, Intercontinental, El San Juan and all others away. Unfortunately there is something about the accommodation there that is just not up to par in the greater San Juan area. Hampton Inn was a great buy and well worth it. You never hear a plane really, other than the fact my room faced the grotesque sport of cockfighting location, the room was ample for my needs. The beds are amazingly comfortable BUT you need to request a sheet change if you so want one. The bathrooms are OK not the best but acceptable. I am a clean freak and did not like the fact the shower was not a handheld and you had to dodge water to wash yourself, but it was clean with the exception of some mold/mildew. I just do not get why they do not teach ALL hotels all over the world to just tell the cleaning people to spray the showers with liquid bleach after each guest and then rinse. Bleach takes care of mold/mildew and is dirt cheap. I also was a bit disgusted by looking up in the bathroom to see pipes above the sink that were green and nasty looking--so I tried not to. I also think a nice touch would be a cheap dressing gown/bathrobe. I do my make-up and hair with a robe on and had to instead use a towel so it was my only complaint. Otherwise everything was great!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a quickie stay”
Reviews.Author: Bonosgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I flew down to San Juan for our friends' wedding this past weekend. Since we knew we couldn't make this trip any sort of vacation, and to call it a getaway was pushing it, we wanted to stay somewhere clean, comfortable and efficient. We got that and so much more! The location was perfect. It's right across the street from the El San Juan hotel (site of the wedding), a Walgreens and Lupi's, a Mexican restaurant recommended to us (it did not disappoint). Plus, the value is the best I've seen in a long time. There's the free breakfast (not gourmet or cooked to order, but there were plenty of options and everything tasted good), the lovely pool area with swim-up bar and grill with burgers so juicy they rival those at In-N-Out and Five Guys, the comfy bed, the flatscreen TV with all the channels of home as well as a plethora of Spanish-speaking ones, the business center and the efficiency of check-in and check-out that could not be beat. Obviously it's not the best choice if you want a luxurious, long-term vacation. This is because it's not on the beach (but it's a block away), and if you want a poolside cocktail, you need to get up and get it yourself rather than have a waiter bring it to you. But I'd recommend this hotel to folks who either are in town briefly for an event or who need a place to stay before or after a cruise. Although, I must say we're tempted to stay here even for a full-on vacation after reading the horrible reviews about the cleanliness and service at the El San Juan hotel. The El San Juan is THE place to be for dancing and partying (and weddings -- the wedding we attending was fabulous), no doubt, but even we noticed dirty couches and an overall indifference of the staff when it came to actually doing their jobs.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for a fraction of what you would spend across the street.”
Reviews.Author: DSXM
Reviews.Content: We were able to get a great rate on a king suite back in November. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. The room had two HDTVs and separate sleeping and living/dining areas. Parking was free since the gate was malfunctioning. Breakfast was okay, but was for gringos. Our only real incident was that or toilet got backed up one afternoon, but maintenance and housekeeping dealt with it right away.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice for a Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: nep1984
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a great Hampton Inn. Rooms were excellent. Service friendly. Location is about 2 blocks from the beach, only a short walk. This is a hotel for people passing through San Juan as it is very close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for wide age group for post-cruise stay.”
Reviews.Author: cktraveloptions
Reviews.Content: We had a day to wait until our flights out from Puerto Rico after a cruise. Our group was 14 people ranging from 4 to 70 and we needed value, convenience and a pool. The property appears to have been recently updated, it was clean, the rooms spacious and beds comfortable. The pool area is large and has a palapa style grill with swim-up bar. The food at this grill is suprisingly good and a regular hamburger is $6. (Not to mention huge.) We had been orginally booked at a resort-style property by our travel agent, but I asked her to move us when I realized that between the tacked-on "resort fees" and having to pay for a "resort breakfast" would be more than resonable. The Hampton Inn has a very servicable breakfast, free business center with internet access and a printer for free use. Very handy for checking flight status and printing boarding passes. There is a Walgreens across the street, the public beach is a few blocks away and there are several restaurants very close by. Oh...although the airport is literally right there, the double windows kept the noise to a minimum--we could see the planes taking off from our window, but could barely hear them. Check out time is noon, but because our flight didn't leave until 5pm, the staff stored our bags and let us use the pool as long as we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value & service”
Reviews.Author: carolevin2009
Reviews.Content: Three friends & myself stayed for 1 comfortable night prior to our Princess Cruise. The staff were very friendly & helpful. The location is excellent . Across the road is a pharmacy , grocery shop & a couple of blocks away is the beach although the pool was just fine. We enjoyed a typical Puerto Rican & reasonably priced meal restaurant in a strip mall across from the extremely expensive Intercontinental Hotel . Then we went next door to our restaurant for Ice Cream. The queen beds were definitely comfortable & we slept well .

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel bad location”
Reviews.Author: nicolaseusebio
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice and clean and the staff was very nice. However, the Isla Verde area is quite dumpy and I felt nervous walking around it. Also, the airplanes are way too loud and ruin the atmosphere. I was with my sister and our children and we were hit on more than once by some shady looking guys which made me really uncomfortable with our young children around. The beach in Isla Verde was dirty and stinky. We didn't even get wet. We stayed at this hotel because we had an early morning flight. I would only recommend staying there if you need to be close to the airport. We also stayed 4 days at the Carbie Hilton, which was very nice. If they could move the hotel to a nice part of town, I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: mwatwe01
Reviews.Content: I have had several extended trips to San Juan this year, and I will only stay at the Hampton Inn & Suites on busy Isla Verde Avenue. It is close to the airport, where I was working, but also close to the beach and several restaurants, all within walking distance. There are also several other shops nearby for the everyday conveniences. Most nights I didn't even leave the hotel since there is a poolside bar and grill outside. Even though I was there on business, my evenings felt like a vacation. This hotel has all the Hampton Inn conveniences while maintaining the lad back Caribbean vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Beach - BEST BET!”
Reviews.Author: LeslieAnnMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: Second time in 12 months at this hotel and another outstanding stay. Obviously many people want an "on the beach" resort, but if you are willing to walk across the street, your savings and satisfaction will be met here! Inexpensive parking, the most friendly front desk staff available, a fantastic poolside grill, clean rooms, linens and comfy beds. This is a fantastic hotel. Breakfast is unbeatable and they change it up daily. The pool grill has fantastic food at a very affordable price for families. Your walk across the street can take you to the Pine Grove area of Isla Verde....go right toward the Ritz resort or the western side near the El San Juan - you must try both sides.......so fun! We can't say enough positive about the Hampton and it's staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to Start a Cruise”
Reviews.Author: business-traveler-Mn
Reviews.Content: We were going out on Carnival Cruise Line on a Sunday, so we arrived a day early and Stayed at the Hampton Inn by the Air Port a $13 dollar cab ride from the airport. Not a bad place stay, the noise from the airport can be deafening around the pool, The bar there does cook a great burger,the room was quiet. There is street work being done at the entrance. the sidewalk is being replaced. We walked the two blocks to the beach on Sunday Morning for a stroll there. The breakfast at the hotel was good, there were cabs at the door when we wanted to leave for the cruise terminal on Sunday morning. Had a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Had to stay an extra day! Budget Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: EmilyDiaz
Reviews.Content: I researched many hotels and motels in the area close to San Juan and couldn't find the right hotel for my husband and I. Until I received a recommendation from my cousins who had just returned from Puerto Rico weeks before. I trusted their choice and booked the hotel immediately. I was pleasantly surprised.. it was exactly what we were looking for. Great Price, found an awesome deal for $100/night through Expedia. We booked two nights at the hotel and when we got there...we had to book a third night. We didn't want to leave. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. We asked a few times for suggestions on places to eat in the area and they gave us honest opinions.. places there were economical but good. The hotel is located in Carolina on Isla Verde Avenue. Surrounded by plenty of places to eat from Chilli's to good ole puerto rican restaurants. Directly across the street there was an awesome ice cream joint (Piu Bella) that sold pastries and bagels. I bought a slice of Flan and had to order another one. haha! The rooms were very clean, AC worked perfectly, the bathrooms spacious and clean. We spent lots of time at the pool which was warm from the sun, and there was always a lounge chair available. The Pool bar/grille had very good food options for a low price. It would open from 9am to 10pm. Every morning there was continental breakfast from 6am to 10am. Very good spread of cold and hot options. They restocked the bread constantly, so everything was fresh. The Hot options varied everyday. One day scrambled eggs with ham, french toast, and another day egg w/ sausage. All in all.. I had a great time at this hotel and was very pleased with my experience at the Hampton Inn. (Negative Points that should be said) If you do have a problem listening to air planes then you might want to think twice about this hotel. Because of the area, not far from the airport. You will hear airplanes flying by quite often. But that is only when you're sitting by the pool.. You will NOTTT hear it in your room. It's very quiet. You are not walking distance to San Juan, you would need a car to get to San Juan or can take a cab. Isla Verde Beach (2 blocks from hotel) isn't one of the best beaches in PR, there are plenty of other beautiful beaches on this island.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice price!”
Reviews.Author: Debradale
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hampton Inn one night pre-boarding Royal Caribbean. Quick $10 cab ride (+ $1/bag) to hotel. Then $19 cab ride to Pan American pier. Dropped our bags off at ship and took another cab to Old San Juan for $15. Wish we had more time in San Juan to visit more attractions. Cabs are zoned and accessible

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: playaplseSanDiego
Reviews.Content: My coworker/friend met me at this hotel to finish the last leg of my solo vacation so I was anxious to have some company. My coworker is a younger person who has limited finances so I was hoping that everything was up to par so that she can enjoy her vacation. We were not disappointed with this hotel. The location was very close to the airport, taxi to the hotel was $12. The hotel staff are very nice and helpful. The hotel, room and grounds are very clean and comfortable. Not on the beach but close enough. Free breakfast was acceptable and satisfying to start the day. Plenty of food places close by. I arrived at 9am and was immediately checked in - no waiting till 3pm. I sure didn't want to haul my luggage around until 3pm. The beds are comfortable and the pillows the best. Free wi-fi either in the hotel or your room

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: lisep18
Reviews.Content: great pool area, friendly staff, nice room free continental breakfast was good, but not a hugh selection

Reviews.Title: “Hands down best hotel in area for Business or budget travel”
Reviews.Author: H8UofFL
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hampton several times over the years on business, as well as some of the fancy hotels nearby on Isla Verde. For a clean and nice place to sleep, as well as a friendly staff, cheap parking and free internet this is the only place in the San Juan metro area that I can recommend. Sure other places are right on the beach, have a fancy pool with $7 cokes and bottles of water, so leave that to the tourists. Lots of flight crews stay here, as well as people coming in early or staying an extra day after a cruise or caribbean vacation while waiting on a flight at the airport (literally right behind the hotel). The staff is extremely friendly and the entire property is very clean, which is a luxury in and of itself in PR. If you are looking for the fancy hotel lobbys, restaurants and expensive restaurants they are all within a 5 minute (or less) walk from the front door. The beach is also 2 blocks away. Just take the side street next to the Walgreens and it drops you right on the same strech of sand used by the Ritz Carlton. This is one of the best Hampton Inns in North America. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: EmJay_1956
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 30 days at this hotel. The staff was very accomodating to every need a long term client can have. Great rooms with essentials to survive away from home. Did not use most of the facilities but they all looked clean and inviting. Highly recommended and it is now part of the Hilton family for those of us that like to get points for our stays.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: TeeTee1975
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here to celebrate our 2nd anniversary and kick off the "honeymoon cruise" that was long overdue. First off let me say..... Hampton Inn & Suites exceeded my expectations. I can not understand why anyone would not give a great review to this hotel. Upon arrival (which was 3 hours before official check in) we were promptly greeted. I did note on the reservation that we were excited to celebrate our anniversary and 'better late than never honeymoon'. Well, much to our surprise the people at the front desk had read the reservation and congratulated us. When we arrived to the room we found another great surprise.....sparkling apple cider, a single long stem pink rose, chocolates and A HAND WRITTEN WELCOME CARD. When was the last time you received a handwritten card??? Well, the simply handwritten happy anniversary and have a wonderful honeymoon card was the cherry on top! I will never forget my wonderful experience and I look forward to a long weekend get away just to return to this Hampton Inn. Oh Yeah.....the burgers that they sell at the pool side grill are the best I have had in years!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: roadwariorrob
Reviews.Content: Great breakfast Good location Close to the airport. Don't miss dinning at Ahili Mohili. The sangirias are fantastic and so is the food.

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ilove2travel0
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with friends for a bachelorette party. THE GOOD: Rooms are clean, the hotel staff was nice (talk to Omar at the front desk). THE BAD: It is not a beachfront property, so you have to walk 2 blocks to the beach (not bad). The beach within walking distance is dirty (cigerette butts everywhere). I recommend researching where the cleaner beaches are on the island. Additionally, go early for breakfast (they stop replenshing the hot breakfast after 9). THE UGLY: The pool is absolutely disgusting. You cannot even see the bottom on the 3 foot side. There are things floating in there, that make you want to vomit. OTHER TIPS: Cabs are very expensive, so rent a car. You can rent one at the Ritz down the street. Go to El San Juan Hotel & Casino to party / drinks. Their lobby is very lively. Lupi's is the only 24/7 eatery around, its not good, but if you gotta eat, you gotta eat! Definitely go to Old San Juan - the restaurant "Mira Buena" is delicious! And also, for authentic local PR food, go check out the food Kiosks on the east tip of the island (30 min drive). I recommend Kiosk #38.

Reviews.Title: “More than satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: hunnygrl420
Reviews.Content: It's no 5 star resort if that's what you are looking for. It's intended purpose is that of a typical airport inn and you will find several pilots, flight attendants, and business people staying there. However, it was quite inpressive for the money. The prices are low and for that price the rooms are comfortable, clean and updated, the lobby is nice, nice pool, great location, and friendly staff. My 2 friends and I stayed there for a vacation trip and were very happy. It's a short walk to the beach, restaurants, bars, clubs and casino's. I would stay there again if returning to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is overrated”
Reviews.Author: travelling_bug2
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here pre-cruise and post-cruise. It was quite convenient and close to the airport and port. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast had a lot of choices, as are Hampton Inn breakfasts. The lobby of the hotel is beautiful and well maintained. The pool area is nice. I used the business center, has updated computers and free use of the printers which I used to print boarding passes. However, I was very disappointed with the rooms, they were not clean, dark and had a musty odor. The bathrooms were not clean as one would expect. We stayed in a suite and the wet bar area was very unclean. The tiles on the bathroom had mold. I felt disgusted while showering. Both times I stayed there, I felt the same way. The airplane noise was not a problem, could not hear it in the rooms. I was very disappointed with this Hampton Inn solely due to the accommodations, after all that is the most important part of the stay. I will not stay there again. If you are looking for a pre-cruise stay I suggest you stay in Old Town San Juan. The beach across the hotel and down a street was nothing to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!”
Reviews.Author: kaisharif
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hampton Inn. The room was snug but was very clean and comfortable. Huge bed, very nice bathroom. I'd definitely give it 4 out of 5 stars. It was near the airport and you can hear the planes taking off but what was great was that the windows were double panned so you could barely hear them with the window closed. Out in the pool area it was a tad bit intrusive but not enough to not enjoy being at the pool. It also had a swim up bar and grill that hands down made the best cheeseburgers we've ever had. I think we ate there 3 nights in a row! We had a lovely view of a cockfighting arena outside our window which we thought was hilarious. We ate at the free breakfast buffet everyday which was good and we appreciated not having to buy breakfast everyday. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to other budget conscious travelers. It was right on the Isla Verde strip and the beach was right across the street. Also across the street was a walgreens which we definitely appreciated as well. The staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: CoopJean
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. Clean, comfortable, quiet, and friendly. Nice restaurant (Metropol) next door. Free wireless Internet as well as business center with wired service (free). Good breakfast, including a couple of hot choices and some fruit as well as a selection of cereals and the customary baked goods. We really liked this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: tkhargrave
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel on May 9, 2009. We stayed there because we were taking the Royal Carribean cruise which left the next day. This hotel was beautiful!! It is very clean and the complimentary breakfast was excellent. The staff was very professional and helpful to us. We were very pleased with our stay and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected”
Reviews.Author: Steve028
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights after a trip to Culebra before flying back to Florida. We found the hotel to be very helpful, allowing us to check in early and giving various directions when needed. The room was spotlessly clean and we paid $127 a night. We got a ground floor room which had TV with cable(BBC World News was nice for us Brits), huge bed, free WI FI, coffee maker but no fridge or microwave. The breakfast was very good and there are plenty of places to eat within walking distance. There's a bus stop opposite the hotel where 75 cents gets you to old San Juan and the beach is a 5 minute walk away. Overall, very nice with no problems encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel near the airport”
Reviews.Author: ksgirl8
Reviews.Content: We just needed a place to stay for one night between getting back from Vieques and flying out of San Juan. This was a great place for that. The room was lovely and was air conditioned and had a TV with cable, which was nice after being in various locations around PR for 10 days. It was more of a suite than a room, with a living room area with a wet bar and then a separate room that was a bedroom. Both rooms had tvs. It was very close to the airport and the breakfast was nice and included with the room. We would definitely stay here again to be close to the airport, though if this is the only place you stay in PR, you are missing the best part.

Reviews.Title: “Good pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: Bostontravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night pre-cruise and used points to pay for the room so the price was right. Otherwise it would have run us about $250 for the night. The front desk staff was very helpful, the room was nice and clean and there were many places to walk out for dinner. The pool area is attractive - decent sized pool, small hot tub, comfy loungers and a good bar/grill (I also agree the hamburger is excellent). You do hear noise from the airport when the planes take off (rendering conversation impossible for 30 seconds at a time), but it's no big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel if you don't mind not being on the beach”
Reviews.Author: Twinkles2008
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night here pre cruise. I thought the room was very clean and nice. The breakfast was good. We ate at the restaurant across the street that has sandwiches and gelato. I think it was called Piu Bella. It was very good. We tried the Cuban and Club sandwiches and tried two different ice creams. I recommend eating here. The walk to the beach was longer than I thought it would be, so be prepared if you want to do that. I swam in front of the Ritz. The water is murky here, but the waves are fun. There is a Walgrees very close to the hotel. We walked to the casinos at the El San Juan and Intercontinental. Be forewarned, they are not very big. Overall, I liked this hotel and location. It might not be great if you are staying a week, but for a few days, it's a great pick.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but perhaps a little overpriced”
Reviews.Author: MichaelOB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went on a cruise and stayed at the Hampton Inn for a few days beforehand so we could see San Juan. The inside of the hotel, especially the rooms, are beautiful. It is a nice looking place and service was good. The breakfast was so-so, not bad, but definitely not great either. My primary reservation with the hotel was the price: 1) Nothing says class like a cock fighting arena outside your window. 2) Going to the beach is a 10 minute walk and once you get there, it is not automatic that you will find a beach chair. 3) A taxi to Old San Juan is $20 each way. We took the public bus for $0.75 each, but it took roughly 50 minutes each way. 4) When at the pool, you could almost feel the wind from the jet engines. None of these are deal-breakers, but I thought the price of $200 a night was a little high (it felt like a $120 hotel). I talked with someone in a nearby restaurant who was at the Courtyard about 5 minutes away, and he paid $20 less a night and was on the beach. If I did this again, I think I would definitely try this next.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: vvheart
Reviews.Content: About 2 mins walk to beach and casino, excellent breakfast, easy transportation, good service. We booked a suite and was later told that it's a room with 2 double beds. Upgrade is $20 extra. The suite accommodates 4 people nicely, would have been nicer if there is a kitchen. Overall it's been pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: campriley
Reviews.Content: We stayed the last night of our vacation here. It was very clean and comfortable. A breakfast is included in your rate (cheese omelet ,sausage,bagels,cereal,yogurt,etc.). There was some airport noise due to how close the hotel is to it. Only a 5 min taxi ride away . Also, a 5 min walk to the Isla Verde beach. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: abettel
Reviews.Content: This is a fine location for a quick stopover in San Juan. The clean, nicely furnished hotel is in the Isla Verde tourist district immediately adjacent to the airport, close to several casinos and numerous eateries. People sensitive to noise should try to avoid rooms in Tower A, which is closest to the airport runways and immediately next to a cock fighting arena whose combatants greet the dawn collectively.

Reviews.Title: “Best Airport Inn Ever!”
Reviews.Author: jld4243
Reviews.Content: After reading many good reviews, we used Honors points for a free night before a flight back to Texas. This was the best decision we could have made. The front desk staff were all wonderful. When we checked in, we asked for a room with 2 beds rather than one. Not only were we given this change, but we were also upgraded to a suite. The room was immaculate and had every ammenity anyone could want. We used our room towels for the pool & upon heading back to our room, we asked for more towels. The towels arrived immediately after we got to our room. The pool was nice as was the pool swim up bar. We decided to go to Metrapol for dinner (good choice) but we were told by 3 other guests that the hamburgers were the best they had ever had....no exceptions. One guest said that he had been there 3 days and had eaten hamburgers at the pool bar 4 times! We heard a plane when we were in the pool. It did require that we stop our conversation for about 15 to 20 seconds. We did not consider this a major inconvenience. We never heard anything when we were in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short time”
Reviews.Author: brencanada
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hampton Inn a few times before, and it was always only for a night or two before a cruise. The hotel is nice, but I wouldn't want to stay for longer than a few nights, seeing as there's not a ton to do. The location is pretty good, there are some nice restaurants and a beach nearby. The pool is good. You can get food, like burgers and grilled cheese, from the bar near the pool. There's a hot tub too and lots of chairs to sit on. The rooms are pretty good. They have a good amount of space, we could fit our whole family of five in one room, which had two queen beds and we had a rollaway as well. The first time we stayed here we had a nice view of the pool, the second time we had an ugly view of the parking lot, but we didn't mind much. Breakfast is great. It's free and a buffet is set up so you can get your breakfast in the lobby. They have coffee, cereal and fruit as well as some hot food like sausage and eggs, as well as toast. For other meals you have to eat at the bar by the pool or go to a nearby restaurant. The location was good here, because it was just a short walk to the beach and many restaurants, however it was very close to the airport as well, which is both good and bad. Good because it doesn't take long to get to the hotel, but bad because there are always planes passing by so it's quite noisy. I would recommend this hotel if you need somewhere to stay for a short amount of time before a cruise, or if you don't plan to do much on your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: siochainDenver
Reviews.Content: Very clean and comfortable. While not on the beaches, on a very convenient (cheap and comfortable too) bus line and very convenient to the airport. We didn't use the pool as we were only there for one night, but it looked clean and inviting. The staff was some of the most friendly and accommodating I've seen. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay before a cruise”
Reviews.Author: luvs2bike
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hampton with my wife, my son and his wife the night before our cruise left port. Other than the double beds being a bit cozy, we had a good stay here. The breakfast in the morning was good and the front desk personel were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful place with great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: kiwina
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean, friendly staff, beautiful decor with a tropical theme through out the place. Pool was abit small and loud from the planes, but we wanted to be near the airport. The poolside bar and grill was fantastic thier burgers were nice and juicy with lots of flavor- only 6.50$( came with a side dish) No problems getting a reasonable cab to the airport. A short walk away you can go to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: ComplexCarb
Reviews.Content: We had booked a one-night pre-cruise stay at the Caribe Hilton, but after I read about the resort taxes at PR locations with casinos, I decided to explore less-expensive options. Traveling with two young children and likely exhausted from a long day of travel, I knew that we were primarily after a place to crash. So after reading some rave reviews of the Hampton Inn, we decided to give it a try. The price was still high since we were traveling during peak time, but about $100 cheaper than the Caribe Hilton overall. The hotel is well-kept, but it is definitely modest and showing its age. The pool area, about which I'd heard raves, is very small and noisy from the nearby airport. We weren't looking for a day in the sun, but just the time we spent on the patio eating dinner was enough to take us back inside for the rest of our stay. Many families seemed to be enjoying the outdoors a great deal. Happily, we really didn't hear any air traffic inside our room. We had a suite with two queen beds and a study, which was just right for the four of us, giving us a little bit of room to stretch out. The room appeared to be clean, with the nice Hilton linens. The hotel staff was very friendly, even at 3 a.m. when we had to request fresh linens and towels after one of our children was sick. The gentleman who delivered these items refused any kind of tip. The grill by the pool had been a major selling point for us, and we weren't disappointed. The sandwiches -- burgers, grilled chicken, and others -- were fresh and juicy and delicious and reasonably priced. It was nice to have a tasty, hearty meal without leaving the hotel property. We would have been tempted to try the swim-up bar if not for the airport din. The free breakfast the next day was typical Hampton fare (identical, in fact, to the breakfast we'd had two weeks previously at a Hampton in Frostburg, Md.), but did the job for us quite nicely. We did not have much of a chance to explore the neighborhood, but we were told that the El San Juan extended casino privileges to Hampton Inn guests, so that could be a selling point for those interested in more of a vacation. A pharmacy across the street proved to be convenient when we needed OTC medication. Next door, however, were cockfighting arenas. Overall, I can't see spending more than one night at the property. It was hardly a vacationer's paradise or more than an appetizer to the beauty of San Juan -- just a convenient place to lay our heads for a night.

Reviews.Title: “Kudos to the Hampton Inn, Carolina, P.R.”
Reviews.Author: Lorenzojones
Reviews.Content: Over the last several years, it has been our rather distinct pleasure to spend part of our winter holiday at the Hampton Inn & Suites in Carolina, P.R. The hotel is most appealing from an aesthetic point of view as well as for its optimal location. It is easy to make day trips to various parts of the island. The individual guest rooms are most comfortable and serviceabe, and the common areas are attractive and spotless. A home away from home is more than just a location or an environment. It is a whole package that leaves a lasting impression. Every person at the Hampton from the owner to the manager to the desk personnel, the maids, the cleaners, maintenance and pool personnel and the breakfast and grill staff are always there to offer service with the proverbial "smile." We have observed many courtesies extended to guests, over the years of our stay. Most recently, a rather tragic incident which ocurred off property, on a scuba expedition, was handled with great compassion, kindness, understanding and efficiency by the entire staff. One would have to look far and wide to obtain a "full package" as we have experienced over the years. Manager Gary Wallace and all of the staff are to be commended for all of their efforts. We feel like "family" when we are at the Hampton. We look forward to our continues stays at this most welcoming residence. Lawrence R. Bolognese Thomas M. Trevisani, Jr.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hampton in All of the America's”
Reviews.Author: enderart
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton HHonors Diamond Member with more than 100 stays per year at the Hilton Hotels, this hotel was the worst hotel that I have ever stayed at, the place seemed like it was from the 1960's, the beds were horrible, the staff's attitude was very conflictive, this hotel should be priced at around $59 per night and not at $189. What a disgrace to Conrad Hilton; the pool, the carpet, the paint, the beds; were all dilapidated. My family and I decided that after a few days, it was time to move on, at which point we advised the hotel and they were insulting by saying "Well, guess its time to go home, because Puerto Rico is expensive," and I responded with "NO, we are moving to a real hotel, like the Embassy Suites; once we arrived at the Embassy Suites, the hotel manager personally took care of us and gave us the Diamond Member treatment. For a difference of only $20, our family was able to recuperate from the dreadful mistake of staying at the "Worst Hampton in All of the America's." This hotel is probably ok for the flying crew; as they are only in for a night, but not for families. My kids had a wonderful time at the Embassy Suites with a Cascading Waterfall and water toys to pass several hours; also the breakfast and food was far superior to anything served at the Hampton. At the Hampton, the cafeteria or area serving food, closed at around 9p.m., what a disappointment. No more stays at Hampton Inns, neither in Puerto Rico nor anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: LinMaryland
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a quick trip to PR with mom to celebrate her 60th. Love the place and the people. We took a jr. suite facing the pool. We had 2 double cloud 9 beds and a large tv in the bedroom. A nice kitchen area with sink, coffee maker, microwave, and mini frig. We also had a living room with couch, chair, desk/table with 2 side chairs and a large tv. All was clean and very nice. Continental breakfasts w/ 2 hot items (eggs/sausage) were provided until 10 am and coffee/tea provided 24 hours. The breakfast made it easy to get our day started without figuring anything out. Pool and jacuzzi are nice with fluffy towels provided. Staff is friendly - recommending buses, restaurants and even having a few menus on hand. Location is very convenient to the airport and you can walk to the beach in a few minutes (ask staff where best beach is since access is limited due to private bldgs and homes). If you take public bus route A5 into Old San Jan as we did expect at least a 1/2 hour ride with a close up experience to PR and its wonderful and warm people. Great restaurant deli across the street - I know it looks like a diner but it is good. Metropol on the other side of the cockfighting arena next door had wonderful cuban fare and drums located in the Isle Verdre mall (2 o'clock from the Hampton front door) had a wonderful red snapper special as well as PR appetizers.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay for the Night Before Your Cruise”
Reviews.Author: Virgin Island Traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn, San Juan for one night before our cruise in November 2007. The property was clean and well kept. Since we arrived late we had dinner & drinks at the pool bar....the food (and prices) were very good. They provide a free buffet breakfast in the morning (average), but be warned....when they say it's served until 10:30.....they mean it. We noticed the staff waiting at the breakfast area 5 minutes before the end time and by 10:30 everything was gone.....so don't be late. The staff was very helpful. They have a business room with free internet & computers/printers. On the negative side....the property is not on the beach. Also you're directly across from the airport......at the pool bar it was very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Its true, great place”
Reviews.Author: skideeppowder
Reviews.Content: True, great place to stay. Great varied breakfast for the family (including a two and six year old). Clean rooms, free internet access, nice pool, nice swim up bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jerseyites2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just arrived home after a wonderful week at the Hampton Inn & Suites in San Juan, Puerto Rico. This hotel is absolutely the best we have stayed at. Its very cozy and has a home feeling. The customer service staff is the greatest! We miss it already and if you're looking for a nice place to stay, please try the Hampton Inn. Thank you to all the ladies in customer service. They are the best!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, not great, nice location”
Reviews.Author: here2help
Reviews.Content: The stay at this hotel was only over night for a flight connection the next day. It is a short $10.50US taxi ride from the airport. Check in was easy, staff is helpful. The room was a pool view suit on the ground floor. In general very old and tired looking, warn and stained carpets, but clean otherwise. Entry is into an office/living area with TV, desk, sofa etc. cable internet hookup worked easily. Sink, coffee maker area. Then the bathroom and closet area in a hallway towards the bedroom. Bathroom supplied with plenty of towels, shampoo, conditioner etc. blow dryer, the usual. Closet had extra pillows, an iron and I don't think it had a safe. Bedroom had a TV and comfy beds with down comforters. Walk to the beach is barely 5 minutes. The beach was mostly deserted in late afternoon, very pretty beach but the small waves looked muddy, maybe recent rains? It looked like you could rent chairs and umbrellas and jet skis at kiosks. Meals at Lupi's, a short walk up the street from the hotel, were wonderful for lunch and dinner and the karaoke was fun to watch. Poolside at the hotel, folks were having fun at the bar, I only tried the Jacuzzi which was barely warm and I was let down by that since I love a good warm Jacuzzi. Air traffic noise was VERY loud pool side, but not to be heard from the rooms. Breakfast buffet was standard fare of decent coffee, rolls, cereals, juices, toast, fruit. This is where you see all the flight crew. Check out easy, no hidden charges, taxi's right outside and ready. On my return trip, I got a MUCH less expensive and MUCH better room at the Radisson using priceline.com

Reviews.Title: “look no further”
Reviews.Author: RicoFan
Reviews.Content: This hotel has to be a sleeper. We have stayed in San Juan on 4 previous occasions over the past 10 years prior to cruising and this is by far and away the best hotel we have experienced. Not only is it less expensive than where we stayed in the past, the rooms (suites?) are larger - about 500 sq ft if you choose a poolview room - the entire hotel is spotless, it's within walking distance from many restaurants, other hotels, car rental agencies, and the beach which incidentally we don't think is that good. The modest comp breakfast satisfies, the burgers at the pool bar are super and the airport noise is a non issue in the rooms due to excellent double paned windows. Forget the over pricing at the hotels with casinos on the beach, you can walk to 3 of them from the Hampton and it's more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stop pre-approved by the flight crews!”
Reviews.Author: to-live-in-Europe
Reviews.Content: Perfect stop pre-approved by the flight crews! Stayed one night, Oct 6. Arrived early enough to enjoy the clean pool and tasty poolside grilled lunch of cheeseburgers and fries prepared to perfection, a bargain at $8. No South Beach diet, but we were on vacation. True, during the day the jets landing on the adjacent runway will momentarily shake your bones, but they don't fly at night. Took a cab to the fabulous (by any standard) Plaza las Americas Mall for the highest quality shops we've seen anywhere in the continental U.S., with better prices, too. The Hampton Inn rooms are spacious, safe and clean with very comfortable beds and all bedclothes are washed daily. Windows are double-paned to reduce noise, but I would request a room on the left wing as you face Reception farther from the runways if you want to nap during the day. Really, at night the noise is not a problem. The airlines would not put their crews there unless it was clean, safe and quiet and a good price close to the airport. Also, 2 blocks away is a fabulous, free, white powder sand beach with gentle waves, possibly the best beach we've ever enjoyed. This place could be a destination unto itself. Lots of good restaurants within safe walking distance. Prefer this to Old San Juan any day.

Reviews.Title: “*Great Service* & *Great Hotel*”
Reviews.Author: momholic50
Reviews.Content: If you go to Puerto Rico this hotel is a must for your stay. The staff is wonderful when it comes to Customer Service satisfaction, they know what they are doing. There is a special girl at the hotel desk name Heidi to whom we really appreciate all the help given to us in our stay at this hotel. HEIDI thank you for everything! The hotel is very clean, spacious rooms, very comfortable beds and the staff goes all the way to provide a good service. Overall our experience was wonderful. We definetely will be back to Hampton Inn & Suites in Isla Verde, Puerto Rico!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: Travelingsky
Reviews.Content: It's above my expectations. The hospitality of the staff, the cleaness of the room, close access to the beach. We got it with points. Can't comment on the price. The cab drive cost $11 to the SJU. $15 to old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great people!”
Reviews.Author: brighteyesWisconsin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hampton Inn & Suites, he was working, I was on leisure. What a beautiful place to be and the staff was wonderful, so friendly and helpful. Housekeeping was excellent, everything was so clean each day. We loved the grill at the pool. They have delicious food and at a good price. The breakfast buffet in the morning was wonderful. There was something different each day. I appreciated the laundry and the computer room. We would go back any time.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, Love It!”
Reviews.Author: Kitty808
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, We love ti, is very private, Front Desk all the agents there are very nice and friendly specially Dianna, she's always wealling to help. Housekeeping is excellent! Maintenance is great! this hotel is very clean, smells good, the pool is very confortable, the rooms are very nice, very clean and the beds are awesome! This hotel is very nice, confortable and customer service is great!

Reviews.Title: “Exceded our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: mayapr99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hampton Inn after our first choice hotel in San Juan the Embassy Suites was full. A bit apprehensive beacuse the proximity to the airport, no noise on our room facing the airport. the food at the pool is absoltly delicious and well price. The $5.00 parking is the cheapest in San Juan. The staff was friendly and helpfull. The continental breakfast was plentifull. Like other hampton suites this location do not have happy hour... Overall a great location for the price. It will definetly be our second choice of hotel in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: papi1096
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights in February 2007. This hotel is about 100 yds from the airport runway. Lots of noise from the jets as they take off. The rooms were clean and the staff was friendly. Has coin operated laundry a plus when traveling with small children. Lots of fast food places nearby. A bit far from Old San Juan and the Ports (15-20 min drive depending on traffic), but I believe there was some sort of public transportation available. The continental breakfast was included, juice, muffins,toast some cold cereal. Overal not a bad place to stay for a night or 2. Swimming pool was small but has a hot tub and a swim up bar.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service - Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: fishcom
Reviews.Content: I was more than impressed with this hotel during our recent visit. The location is very convenient to the Isla Verde area, the airport and highways. Although the hotel is not on the beach it is an easy walk (about 3 blocks). Several great restaurants in the area that are not too expensive - you have to look around and stay out of the big beach front places if you are on a budget. We upgraded to a suite and it was well worth the extra money. The rooms were very spacious. Bed and linens were beautiful and the housekeeping was immaculate. This hotel is a great option if you are new to San Juan and especially if you have a rental car - easy parking for only $5 per day. The front desk staff was the most friendly of any hotel I have ever stayed. They accommodated all our requests and gave great directions and were just really nice. I saw some other properties in the area - they were either much more money than the Hampton, or looked run-down and dirty. We enjoyed our stay so much, we extended for 2 additional nights. Only complaints: Pool has too much chlorine and made us cry, sound of the landing airplanes is annoying - but I never travel without my ear plugs. Hey, its is 5 minutes to the airport! You will hear some planes. But overall - this hotel is HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value but think about the location.”
Reviews.Author: Duluth-Dublin
Reviews.Content: Not knowing as much as we would have liked, and relying heavily on Trip Advisor reports to decide where to stay, we need to weigh in on the subject of location. The Hampton is a really nice hotel and it's a decent value but if you are unfamiliar with the territory (as we were), it probably isn't what you're looking for if you want to spend time at Isla Verde OR in Old San Juan (OSJ). The closest access to Isla Verde is several (long) blocks away. Because you aren't staying at a hotel on the beach, there is no free lounge chairs, etc., so you will need to take beach towels to stay on. And, pretty as it is, it is also crowded, urban-style beach. If that is to your taste, you might want to consider one of the hotels on the beach. When we checked, there wasn't too much difference in price. Others had reviews talking about the plane noise, but it's here too so... If you want to go to OSJ, be prepared for either a l-o-n-g bus ride (where they herd you in like cattle and you might be standing for the entire ride) or spendy taxi fees ($20 plus tip each way). If you're making a single visit, that might not be an issue. If you are planning on multiple visits (as we were), it doesn't make sense to stay here. Assuming you DO want to stay here (and let me stress, it's a VERY nice property, just not necessarily in a great location), know that there are a couple of nice restaurants in the immediate walking area but one, Platos, is very expensive. Metropol restaurant (a chain offering great PR & Cuban food) is just one building away and there is a Mexican restaurant (Lupi's, I believe) a short hop away. Don't discount the food at Hampton, though. The pool bar & grill (serving through lunch and dinner) offered a good selection at very reasonable prices. Their cheeseburger (around $6) was the biggest I've ever seen and was just delicious. Even the drinks are decent prices for the location. The free breakfast is good too, with a hot offering that changes daily. The value on this property is fair and the property itself is wonderfully maintained and very attractive. I wish I could give it a great endorsement in all areas because I think the staff do a super job and are very accommodating, but it just isn't in a very convenient location for either Isla Verde Beach or Old San Juan

Reviews.Title: “Good Value & Very Accomodating”
Reviews.Author: A_Michigan_Traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night post-cruise. Friendly attentive staff. We arrived at 11am expecting to check luggage and come back later. Instead, they gave us our room! Small pool with a swimup bar serving excellent burgers and sandwiches. Airport noise IS annoying at poolside. I would not recommend this hotel if you are looking to spend several days relaxing by the pool. Would recommend for a night or 2 on the way through San Juan. Expensive to go to old San Juan via taxi - $25 or so. Could use city bus to Old San Juan which comes by frequently but would require 45 minutes of travel time each way. Nearby beach (3 block walk) is average. Go to beach a bit east of this location past ESJ towers, not directly from hotel (where a storm sewer possibly contaminated with real sewage drains). Room was clean and beds were fine. Bathroom was slightly in need of refurbishing though clean and fully functional. We were in a 3rd floor room toward the main entrance side and facing away from the airport. There was no airport noise in our room. For the price and staying a night or 2 you won't be a bit disappointed. For a longer stay in this neighborhood, I would recommend the nearby Embassy Suites (stayed there 3 nights - nice pool which is much quieter) or Holiday Inn (looked at but didn't stay there).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: BlushPell
Reviews.Content: I recently booked the Hampton Inn for a precruise one night stay. The price was reasonable by Puerto Rico standards $200 per night. We arrived early and our room wasn't ready but they took our luggage and we went next door to a little Cuban restaurant called Metropol. The food was very good and I recommend eating here. The location of the hotel is really kind of industrial. There isn't anything scenic to see there. Across the street is a pharmacy that you can pick up any items that you need. We didn't find any good liquor stores nearby and the only thing that we found to purchase at a local market was beer and some rum. The beach that is within walking distance is ok. It is not the nicest beach I have ever been to and there were a lot of locals. The other big hotels Intercontinental and the Ritz are all within walking distance. The lobby always had nice tropical fruit candles burning and was very clean and inviting. The pool area was small but I will agree with other posters that it is LOUD! I would not recommend this hotel to someone who is trying to find a place with a relaxing pool scene. It sounds like the planes are about 15 feet away from you! It is a little nerve wracking at first. There is a pool bar and they have some food items available there too. We had a room on the fourth floor of the hotel and yes you could hear the planes in the room. It was not as bad as the pool area though. It sounded more like a thunderstorm than a plane. It is nothing that would keep you up at night. The room was clean and had all the amenities that you needed. Iron, storage, hair dryer, coffee maker, and safe. We didn't have much of a view(a parking lot). I would recommend this hotel just because of the price and comfort of the room. However, I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone that is going to be doing extensive sight seeing in Old San Juan. The cab fares to and from Old San Juan are very expensive. We paid $25 each way with tip to get to and from the area. We dined in OSJ one night and that is a big expense to keep adding to the price of your trip. Just something to consider when booking this hotel. There is a bus that comes by but it didn't look like it would be an enjoyable or even short ride. Old San Juan is about 15 minutes by cab without stopping the bus takes a lot longer. The hotel also has a hot breakfast available in the morning that is served in their lobby. It is the usual Hampton Inn fare but very good and nice to wake up to.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: acequeen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Feb. 16th & 17th 2007. We couldn't have picked a nicer Hotel. The rooms were very clean and updated. The king bed was incredible. Very high quality mattress and pillows. The manager and staff were very accomodating. We enjoyed the pool area and bar. The complimentary breakfast hit the spot in the morning. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and we will definately stay there next time we go to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - better than any Hampton”
Reviews.Author: moomooWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: I think this is the nicest Hampton Inn we have stayed at. We paid in the mid 250s because everything was booked Presidents's Day weekend, but we were totally pleased with the hotel. I had previously stayed at the Hilton Caribe and really liked that - its a better location for getting to Old Town - but the Hampton is opposite the street from the Ritz and other hotels, allowing more access to restaurants, casinos, etc. The hotel is very clean (far more so than the four star El Conquistador Resort, for example!) and the beds are as good as the best Westin beds. The breakfast is an actual hot breakfast, plus so many other choices of cereals, juices, breads, and bagels, fruit, yogurt, granola, etc. - better than most Hampton Inns. The rooms were quite, the pool looked nice (we did not use) and the staff were helpful. I highly recommend this hotel over many four star establishments in Puerto Rico!

Reviews.Title: “Really liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Phillykathy
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked the Hampton Inn for 2 nights pre-cruise. We were very happy with this hotel. The price was much cheaper than most other hotels in the area. Though the area is expensive as a whole. The hotel was clean, the bed was very comfortable, the breakfast was better than adequate, the pool bar area & grill were very nice also. The burgers are huge and juicy. We walked about a block or 2 to Isla Verde beach which was very nice. We also took the bus into Old San Juan. You catch it out front for .75 cents. I would not suggest it. Pay the extra money and take the cab. The bus was packed wall to wall people and the driver had people flying all over the place because he drove crazy. It also took triple the time as the cab ride home. We waited at least 30-40 minutes for the bus to pick us up also and the locals told us that is the norm because the drivers get paid either way so have no incentive to be on time. We did not have any problems with air conditioning in our room. Ours worked very well. It was freezing in the room. We also had no problems getting pool towels. They had an area at the pool whee u get get towels/dispose of towels. The grill outside does run out of things (certain beer,etc) but we just chose something else then. All in all we had a very good time here and would stay at the Hampton Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: suepaul93
Reviews.Content: We were here for one night post cruise just to relax and we were delighted with the service and amenities. Wireless internet is a plus after being without for a week. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. The location was decent just a two block walk to the beach and the main street. The beach was very nice. Would stay here again especially for the price booked with hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with a Few bumps”
Reviews.Author: beckylynn
Reviews.Content: We came into Peurto Rico late and had previously booked another hotel. The hotel we had chosen was not going to work so we called a travel agent and she booked us at the Hampton. The first three nights our air was not working and we had someone come and fix it however it did not work. The phone in our room was also out of order. They had attempted to fix it but that did not work. We had a wedding to attend and we called again about the air and someone from the front desk came up to see that it was very warm and went ahead and switched us to a new room. We were late to our wedding due to switching rooms 2 hours prior to the wedding. The pool was a beautiful place to be. The airplanes were loud but tollerable. However people were constantly having to ask for towels. The bar by the pool had wonderful burgers available all day. On our third day the bar ran out of Corona, Nanchos, limes, and Medalla. This to me was frusturating. Some people go on vacation to sight see and others go to lay pool side and soak up the sun and just be free of a schedule and with these luxuries missing that is not easliy accomplished. The hotel was a very nice place to stay and I would recommend it. I feel that they really need to be more orgainized and on top of things after all you are not spending $1900.00 for two beds and a nice shower. We were compt one night and a rollaway bed. To me that is just not right when they clearly say Hampton Inn 100% Gurantee.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: alaskancrzr
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hampton Inn for a pre-cruise stay on the basis of recommendations on Trip Advisor and we weren't dissappointed. The king size bed was wonderfully comfortable, air conditioning fully functional, the room clean, quiet, and nice looking. The staff was fantastic --from check-in to tour arrangements to holding our bags for half a day while we did a pre-cruise tour of El Yunque. The food from the poolside bar was very good and the noise when outside, though loud, not overwhelming. We got a rate of $146 through Hampton's web site and felt that we definitley got our money's worth. For a pre/post cruise stay you'd be hard pressed to find a better deal!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but take earplugs”
Reviews.Author: r.butterworth
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights prior to cruise, was aware from previous reviews that location is close to airport but did not noise outside (at pool) would be so intrusive Staff very helpfull, rooms a good size and really clean with comfortable beds. Hotel easy walk to local independant and chain restaurants. Good beach also an easy walk where you can hire loungers, parasols etc

Reviews.Title: “One of the better values in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: thorntree
Reviews.Content: We stayed here prior to a cruise as we had last year.Following our earlier stay I gave a generally positive review of this hotel (on February 13, 2006) except for the malfunctioning air conditioning unit for which we were given a suitable adjustment (we were compted). No such problem this time as every thing was fine, No airport noise in the room, the pool was great, the area has a lot to offer as far as restaurants etc. This is not a fancy hotel , but a Hampton INN and one of the better ones at that. One criticism I have is the price of ALL of the hotels in San Juan which have been creeping upward in each of the past 5 years I have been visiting San Juan. I believe an AARP rate of $200 is too expensive for this hotel just as the $300-$500 rates are too expensive for the fancier hotels nereby that were in the $200 plus range only a few years ago..

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest Hampton Inns!”
Reviews.Author: LAinLC
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed everything about my stay at this Hampton Inn. The room was very comfortable, and the amenities were terrific. The room thermostat could be programmed to the precise degree. Continental breakfast was plentiful, coffee was available all day. Beds and pillows were fantastic. I even liked the hotel's black and white graphics. If you don't have a car and don't enjoy the city bus, it can be a bit expensive to get around, because Isla Verde isn't within walking distance to many of the places to see. [We dealt with this by staying a few nights at the Hampton Inn, a couple of nights in Ponce, and the rest of the time in Old San Juan]. But try the Metropol restaurant on the other side of the cock-fighting (!) stadium next to the hotel -- terrific food, and you can watch the turtles in the pond outside the restaurant's glass window. Plato's was pretty good, too, if a bit loud. The ice cream place next to Plato's is enjoyable as well.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, cute”
Reviews.Author: Debbie_F
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay near the airport since we were arriving late at night and leaving the next day to drive around the island. Since the Hampton Inn was near the airport, we decided to stay there. After we checked in, we saw our flight crew arrive and check in too. The lobby was really cute, with great colors, artwork, table and chairs - it was not like any other Hampton Inn we've stayed at. Breakfast included ham and scrambled eggs (in formed patties) and were good for making a scrambled egg sandwich. My friend had a hamburger at the grill by the pool and said it was one of the best hamburgers he has ever had. There is a city bus or trolley that stops out front to take you to Old San Juan. The rooms were clean and although a bit on the small side, included a desk, armoire with TV, a chair and ottoman and a king size bed. Every now and then, you would hear a plane fly over, but I did not find the noise annoying. We would have been happy spending several nights here.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I needed ie: One Stop Shopping”
Reviews.Author: nigelsmom1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hampton for three nights prior to my cruise on Sept 3rd. Even though the Hampton is close to the airport, not one person at the establishment seemed to mind. First night was quiet, with my husband (got married on the cruise) and I became aquainted with surroundings. We arrived at noon and our room was ready. Even though we had a view of the parking lot and nearby cock fight stadium this did not damper our enthusiasm. The room was great. Clean, king size bed, decent furnishings, safe, ironing board, and toiletries in the bathroom. Watch out for the AC or at least adjust it as our room was ice cold all the time. Staff was nice, and we even got a welcome call. Speaking of which 800 # calls & local calls were free and so was wireless internet and use of the business center downstairs for printing and web surfing. Pool was sufficient and stayed crowded after the first night with kids, and adults frequenting the swim up bar. The Hampton is across the street from a small strip mall., where I was able to do my nails (for the wedding) and purchase other essentails for the trip. ATM around the corner from the strip mall and if you tired of the free breakfast at the Hampton a Denny's was just feet away. Good resturaunt that locals and tourists alike is right next door (The Metro.....??) and cabs are stationed outside if you want to go Old San Juan. Hotel was able to arrange tour of Rain Forest, El Yunque and despite the rigourous hiking, the tour was the highlight of our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: daffund
Reviews.Content: LOVE IT! Very clean, beautifully decorated! New carpets. Pool is nice, the grill by the pool is good. It's within walking distance to a bunch of restaurants and pharmacy. The supermarket is around the corner, just a short drive, which was very convenient. The breakfast was great, a slight change every day, everything was fresh and tasty. Our only complaint is that it's so close to the airport so you hear them when they take off (in rooms too).

Reviews.Title: “Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lakehouse1
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel for a quick family stay.
