We were there one night and it was perfect for a one dayer to see Old San Juan, enjoy a nice hotel room, use the pool and have a good breakfast. The place was clean and well maintained. Only draw back was that it was a bit noisy, as the hotel is located right at the end of the runway for the airport, so every time a jet takes off you know it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Loved it !!!! Best rates”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a GREAT HOTEL !!! Excellent Value for the money, not too pricey ! My Family and I stayed here post cruise for a couple of nites, staff is helpful, the rooms are of good size, the continental breakfast is GREAT (better than expected). I would definitely stay here again. There's a swim up bar & grill, FREE INTERNET SERVICE w/office supplies if needed, restaurants & entertainment within walkin distance 5 minutes (churchs chicken, subway, ponderosa, burger king, wendy's, Ruth Chris, casino, cockfight arena, small grocery store), 5 minute walk to the beach. If you have children that's great too, but not for more entertainment do an excursion while you're there & sightseeing !!! The closet beach is not for kids, the waves are big and the sand swells with each wave, try another beach. The beds are comfortable as well, we had 2 Dbl bed room, nice and comfy for 4 people.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business-class Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean, the staff was friendly, and every was exactly as I expected for this class of business hotel. Traveling on business, internet access was important and the in-room access was fast and reliable. There is also a small business center with internet-connected computers for those who aren't traveling with laptops. The location is convenient, with plenty of restaurants a short walk away - be sure to try the excellent Cuban restaurant next door to the hotel. There is a small market a five-minute walk away where you can get drinks and snacks if you don't want to plug change into the vending machines. There is also a drugstore across the street. The planes may be loud at the pool, but my room was very quiet with the air conditioner on. Like other Hampton Inns, there is a free breakfast, but this one offered food a step above some other Hamptons. The main breakfast entree one morning was a half-bagel topped with egg, cheese, and bacon - it tasted like something you would find in the supermarket freezer section, but better than fast food. The next morning was French toast and sausage, which was decent; more akin to a Shoney's buffett than a home-cooked meal, but it comes with the price of the room, and there was plenty of fruit, yogurt, cereal, and other breakfast foods. If you don't like it, you can walk to Denny's across the street or one of dozens of other high-priced restaurants in the neighborhood When I checked out, I forgot a couple of shirts I left hanging in the closet. I was still in town, so I walked up to the Hampton Inn a few hours later and asked about the clothing. In about three minutes, my shirts appeared - neatly folded and placed into a plastic bag with my account number ready for me to claim. If you are traveling on vacation, or just have some free time on business, the beach is a short walk away - but it's far enough that you won't want to pop back to the room to use the restroom or grab a drink. The pool area seemed small and enclosed, but had a nice little bar that served food. Fine for business and probably acceptable for short periods on vacation, but this isn't a 5-star beach resort. FYI - if you have a rental car, parking is $5 per night, and you have to pay if you spend more than 20 minutes in the parking lot. If you're picking up a rental car for the day and need to stop by the hotel, make sure you get in and out fast. (NOTE - I rented a car from Charlie Car Rental a short walk down the street. They're open 24 hours, great service, clean cars, and you avoid the cab fare to the airport for a rental car if you aren't picking one up for the duration of your stay.) SUMMARY - I have absolutely no complaints. If I was on vacation, I might want a place on the beach instead of a 10-minute walk away, but the price is lower than an on-beach resort. For business travelers, this is a great location.

Reviews.Title: “It's lovely if you stay indoors”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While planning our trip to Puerto Rico, I was shocked by how expensive most of the "nice" hotels were, even in low season (we went first week of April). This hotel lured me to book with it with its relatively lower price, nice photos, and good reviews. It turns out that the hotel IS pretty great. The front-desk staff was pleasant and helpful (we had to store our luggage with them for a day after checking out and there were no problems), the lobby was gorgeous, the breakfast was top notch (and free!), and our room was perfect, with silky smooth bedsheets, a clean bathroom, and ample space. The only problem is when you step outside to use the pool and hottub - the swim-up bar is cute and the hamburger fare offered there is good (albeit a bit too salty), but every ten minutes it sounded like an airplane was about to crash-land on your head. I could not believe how noisy it was, and I've lived near LGA airport all my life. It was literally like the planes were landing next door (and I guess they sort of were). Fortunately, the hotel itself is well insulated, so the noise doesn't affect you at all when you're inside. If it weren't for the noisy pool, the hotel would be an easy A+ (and probably cost a lot more). As it is, I give it an A-.

Reviews.Title: “The Price is Right!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn San Juan post cruise. We were looking for the best hotel for the money and I think we found it. Yes, the hotel is RIGHT by the airport - when you're at the pool you definitely hear the engines roar, but in the room I never heard the airport. The pool is nice - small, but clean with a swim up bar and grill. There were plenty of chairs by the pool and the towels were warm and cozy. The room itself was very well kept and clean and while the beds are on the smaller size, very comfortable. The location is very good - you're right across the street from the InterContinental and the Ritz Carlton in case you feel like you want to explore the resorts. We found the hotel staff to be very friendly and helpful. Cab rates to and from the hotel are fixed by the government, so you feel comfortable heading wherever you'd like. Our flight was too early in the morning to sample the breakfast, but I would definitely recommend the Hampton Inn for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: cweber5000
Reviews.Content: I travel to PR several times a year and always stay at the Hampton Inn in Isla Verde. I always have a wonderful experience - the staff are very friendly and helpful (will always point you to a great restaurant or book a local tour), the rooms are large and clean, and the location is excellent. You have a short walk to the beach, a ton of restaurants, and bars. There are several other large hotels nearby (on the beach) that are extremely overpriced and stuffy. I have stayed in a variety of these hotels as well and always have a poor experience. I highly recommend the Hampton Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Not so Great”
Reviews.Author: snowbiz100
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March, 2006 The Good: Overall itâ€™s a nice hotel, although its far from a new property. The breakfast ins included and they do a nice job- choice of coffees and tea, fruit, a hot item, cereals, yogurt etc. The business center is a nice plus and offers free printing. The pool is on the small side- but never looked crowded. The people are friendly The not so good: The hotel has suites and standard rooms- I was in a standard room. The furniture is newer, but the rooms themselves are kind of beat up ( some mildew on the over calked bath tub, â€œblackâ€� material coming from the piper in the tub, etc.). The hotel is very close to the airport and if you have the windows open you feel like you are sleeping on a run way. As with most Hamptons â€“ this location offers no room service or restaurant- there is however a snack area at the pool- but it closes fairly early. Summary- stay there if the price is right but compare the Marriott Price and Availability first

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Gets 5 Stars!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hamtpon Inn & Suites for spring break and had a wonderful experience! It's a great hotel for the price, not to mention in a good location. The staff was very nice and offered lots of suggestions for places to eat and have fun; they also had answers to all our questions. The Business Center with free internet and printing was a nice surprise, and there was also wireless in the room. The hotel overall is well-kept and clean and the beds are small but comfortable. When I go back to Puerto Rico, I will definitely book at the Hampton Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. Although there is airplane noise out at the pool, it was rarely heard inside. The staff is friendly and very helpful. The breakfast is great. The pool is wonderful and well kept. There are lots of good restaurants at the big hotels nearby but be prepared..they are pricey! all in all, we really enjoyed our stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Cubbiefan
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, wonderful front desk staff, great breakfast buffets. I had one small problem with my phone and one of the maintenance personnel overhead my comment. Next thing I know, he's upstairs fixing the phone! What service! Very personable staff - always friendly and polite. I can't say enough about them. The Tuesday night buffets are okay - get there early because the food does run out! The food by the pool area is good. As with everything in Puerto Rico, make sure you allow plenty of time - it's definitely NOT fast food! Close to the airport, but you can't hear the noise unless you're by the pool. You really can't go wrong here!

Reviews.Title: “Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: antzinpants
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely located approx 2 blocks from the beach. Great breakfast, with friendly staff! The beds and pillows are excellent....I went down with a bunch of teenagers, so we have a couple of rooms. I thought the suites were on the small side. Hotel staff is friendly and keeps the 100% satisfaction guarantee at heart. I found the front desk personnel friendly and always ready to help.
